Clause_Text:
PROPORTIONATE CLAUSE:
If the Insured Person is admitted in the hospital in a room where the room category or
the Room Rent incurred is higher than the eligibility as specified in the Policy
Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance, then the Policyholder/ Insured Person shall bear a
rateable proportion of the total & specified Associated Medical Expenses (including
surcharge or taxes thereon) in the proportion of the difference between the Room Rent
of the entitled room category/eligible Room Rent to the Room Rent actually incurred.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which the policyholder or insured person may be required to pay a portion of the medical expenses if the room rent incurred is higher than the eligible room rent as specified in the policy schedule or certificate of insurance.

Clause_Text:
2.5 PRE – HOSPITALISATION MEDICAL EXPENSES COVER :
The Policy covers, on a reimbursement basis, the Insured Person’s Pre-hospitalization
Medical Expenses incurred due to a covered illness/disease/injury that occurs during
the Policy Period upto 30 Days and upto the amount limit as specified in the Policy
Schedule or Certificate of Insurance Or actual expenses incurred, whichever is less,
provided that:
(i) Claim for In-patient Hospitalization is admissible under terms/conditions of policy
(ii) The Pre-hospitalisation Medical Expenses are related to covered
illness/disease/injury only & same illness incident for which claim of In Patient
Hospitalisation was admitted.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the coverage for pre-hospitalization medical expenses under the health insurance policy, with conditions and limits.
Key_Terms: ['Pre-hospitalization Medical Expenses', 'Covered illness/disease/injury', 'Policy Period', 'Amount limit', 'In-patient Hospitalization', 'Claim']

Clause_Text:
(iii) The date of admission to the Hospital for the purpose of this Benefit shall be the
date of the Insured Person’s first admission to the Hospital in relation to the same Any
One Illness.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the date of admission for the purpose of the benefit, which is the date of the first admission to the hospital related to the same illness.

Clause_Text:
2.6 POST – HOSPITALISATION MEDICAL EXPENSES COVER:
The Policy covers, on a reimbursement basis, the Insured Person’s Post-hospitalization
Medical Expenses incurred due to a covered illness/disease/injury that occurs during
the Policy Period upto 60 Days and upto the amount limit as specified in the Policy
Schedule or Certificate of Insurance Or actual expenses incurred, whichever is less,
provided that:
(i) Claim for In-patient Hospitalization is admissible under terms/conditions of policy
(ii) The Post-hospitalisation Medical Expenses are related to covered disease & same
illness incident for which claim of In Patient Hospitalisation was admitted.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the coverage for post-hospitalization medical expenses due to a covered illness/disease/injury during the policy period, up to 60 days and up to the amount limit as specified in the policy schedule or actual expenses incurred, whichever is less. The claim for in-patient hospitalization must be admissible under the terms/conditions of the policy, and the post-hospitalization medical expenses must be related to the covered disease and the same illness for which the claim of in-patient hospitalization was admitted.
Key_Terms: ['Post-hospitalization Medical Expenses', 'Covered illness/disease/injury', 'Policy Period', 'Amount limit', 'In-patient Hospitalization', 'Claim', 'Covered disease']

Clause_Text:
3.30 MEDICAL EXPENSES means those expenses that an Insured Person has
necessarily and actually incurred for medical treatment on account of Illness or Accident
on the advice of a Medical Practitioner, as long as these are no more than would have
been payable if the Insured Person had not been insured and no more than other hospitals
or doctors in the same locality would have charged for the same medical treatment..
3.31 MEDICALLY NECESSARY TREATMENT means any treatment, tests,
medication, or stay in hospital or part of a stay in hospital which:
i) is required for the medical management of the illness or injury suffered by the insured;
ii) must not exceed the level of care necessary to provide safe, adequate and appropriate
medical care in scope, duration, or intensity;
iii) must have been prescribed by a medical practitioner;
iv) must conform to the professional standards widely accepted in international medical
practice or by the medical community in India.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the terms 'MEDICAL EXPENSES' and 'MEDICALLY NECESSARY TREATMENT' in the context of health insurance

direct complications shall be excluded until the expiry of 48 months of
continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy with the
insurer.

under the portability norms of the extant IRDAI ( Health Insurance)
Regulations, then waiting period for the same would be reduced to the extent
of the prior coverage.

Clause_Text:
CONDITIONS
5.1 BASIS OF INSURANCE:
This Policy is issued based on the truth and accuracy of statements in the Proposal.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies the basis for which the insurance policy is issued, emphasizing the importance of truth and accuracy in the proposal.

Clause_Text:
If
there is any misrepresentation or non-disclosure of material facts, the Company will
treat the Policy as void ab initio.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to the consequences of misrepresentation or non-disclosure of material facts.

Clause_Text:
5.2 ENTIRE CONTRACT :
This Policy /Prospectus/ Proposal Form and declaration given by the insured constitute the
complete contract.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the completeness of the contract

Clause_Text: Insurer may alter the terms and conditions of this Policy/contract.
Annotation_Notes: This clause allows the insurer to modify the terms and conditions of the policy.

Clause_Text:
Any
alteration that may be made by the insurer shall only be evidenced by a duly signed and
sealed endorsement on the Policy
5.3 COMMUNICATION :
Every notice or communication to be given or made under this Policy shall be delivered in
writing at the address of the Policy issuing office / Third Party Administrator as shown in the
Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the method for delivering notices or communications under the policy.

Clause_Text:
5.4 PAYMENT OF PREMIUM :
The premium under this Policy shall be paid in advance.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerabilities or ambiguities

Clause_Text:
No receipt for premium shall be
valid except on the official form of the Company signed by a duly authorized official
of the company.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the requirements for a valid premium receipt.

Clause_Text:
The payment of premium and the observance and fulfilment of the terms,
provisions, conditions and endorsements of this Policy by the Insured Person in so far as
they relate to anything to be done or complied with by the Insured Person shall be
condition precedent to any liability of the Company to make any payment under this
Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions that the insured person must meet to ensure the insurance company's liability for payment.
Key_Terms: ['payment of premium', 'observance and fulfilment', 'terms, provisions, conditions and endorsements', 'liability', 'Company', 'payment under this Policy']

Clause_Text:
No waiver of any terms, provisions, conditions and endorsements of this Policy shall
be valid, unless made in writing and signed by an authorized official of the Company.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for any waiver or amendment of the policy terms.

Clause_Text:
5.5 PLACE OF TREATMENT AND PAYMENT:
- This Policy covers Medical/ Surgical treatment and/or services rendered in India.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or ambiguity in the clause

Clause_Text: - Admissible claims shall be payable only in Indian Rupees.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies the currency in which claims will be paid.

Clause_Text: - Payment shall be made directly to Network Hospital if Cashless facility is availed.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the method of payment when a cashless facility is availed.

Clause_Text:
If
request for Cashless facility is not availed/approved, bills and Mandatory documents
will be required to be submitted for reimbursement.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the process for submitting bills and documents for reimbursement when the cashless facility is not availed or approved.

Clause_Text:
In case admissibility of a claim is disputed at the initial stage and
warrants further verification/investigation of treatment, records etc., request for
Cashless facility may be declined.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the denial of cashless facility in case of disputed claims requiring further verification or investigation.

Clause_Text: Insurer’s decision in this regard will be final.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the finality of the insurer's decision.

Clause_Text: Denial of Cashless facility would not imply denial of claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the relationship between cashless treatment and claim settlement.

Clause_Text:
If Cashless facility is
denied, Insured may submit the papers on completion of treatment and admissibility
of the claim would be subject to the terms, conditions and exclusions of the Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which a cashless facility denial may lead to the submission of papers and the subsequent admissibility of the claim, subject to the terms, conditions, and exclusions of the policy.

Clause_Text:
5.6 CLAIMS PROCEDURE:
A.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for filing a claim.

Immediate written notice of claim with particulars relating to Policy Number, ID Card No.,
Name of Insured Person in respect of whom claim is made, Nature of disease / Injury
and Name and Address of the attending Medical Practitioner / Hospital /Nursing
Home etc.

should be given to the Company / TPA while taking treatment in the

Such notice should be Communicated/ delivered to Company by Insured/Insured’s

Within 24 hours from the date of emergency hospitalization required or before the

At least 48 hours prior to admission in Hospital in case of a planned Hospitalization

such notice or file claim within the prescribed time limit.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines a time-based exclusion for hospitalization, with the possibility of waiver in extreme cases of hardship.

Otherwise Company

Any

Provider as the case may be.

If the deficiency in the necessary claim documents is not
met or is partially met in 10 working days of the first intimation, Insurer/TPA will
send a maximum of 3 (three) reminders.

decide to deduct the amount of claim for which deficiency is intimated to the Insured
Person and settle the claim if insurers observe that such a claim is otherwise valid
under the Policy.

In case a reimbursement claim is received when a pre-authorisation letter has been
issued, before approving such a claim, a check will be made with the Network

Provider whether the pre-authorisation has been utilized as well as whether the

Once such check

v. In case of non-submission of documents requested in the deficiency request within
seven days from the date of receipt of the deficiency request, three reminders shall be
sent by the TPA at an interval of seven days each.

The claim shall be eligible for repudiation if the documents, mandatory for taking
the decision of admissibility of the Claim, are not submitted within seven days of the
third reminder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a time limit for submitting documents required for claim processing.

Clause_Text:
If the required documents are such that it does not affect the
admissibility of the claim and is limited to payment of certain expenditure only, the
Claim will be paid after reducing such amount from the admissible amount.

Clause_Text:
F. CLAIM SETTLEMENT( PROVISION OF PENAL INTEREST):
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the provision of penal interest in the context of claim settlement.

Clause_Text:
All medical treatment for the purpose of this insurance will have to be taken in India
only and all claims shall be payable in Indian currency only.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the geographical location where medical treatment for the insurance is applicable and the currency in which claims will be paid.

Clause_Text:
The Company shall settle or reject a claim, as the case may be, within 30 days
from the date of receipt of last necessary document.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the timeline for claim settlement by the insurance company.

Clause_Text:
However, where the circumstances of a claim warrant an investigation, in the
opinion of the Company, it shall initiate and complete such investigation at the
earliest, in any case not later than 30 days from the date of receipt of last necessary
document.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the investigation process in case of a claim, specifying a timeframe of 30 days for completion.

Clause_Text:
In such cases, the Company shall settle the claim within 45 days from the
date of receipt of last necessary document..
iv.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the time frame within which the insurance company is required to settle a claim.

Clause_Text:
In case of delay beyond stipulated 45 days, In case of delay
beyond stipulated 45 days, the Company shall be liable to pay
interest to the policyholder at a rate 2% above bank rate from the date
of receipt of last necessary document to the date of payment of claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for the payment of interest to the policyholder in case of a delay in claim settlement.
Key_Terms: ['delay', 'stipulated 45 days', 'Company', 'policyholder', 'interest', '2% above bank rate', 'last necessary document', 'payment of claim']

Clause_Text:
(“Bank rate” shall mean the rate fixed by the Reserve Bank of India
(RBI) at the beginning of the financial year in which claim has fallen due)..
vi.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the term 'Bank rate' in the context of health insurance

Clause_Text:
Insurer shall have no liability to make payment of a claim under the Policy in
respect of an Insured Person once the Sum Insured for that Insured Person is
exhausted.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition under which the insurer will not pay a claim. It is important for policyholders to understand when they may not receive payment.

Clause_Text:
Insurers are not obliged to make payment for any claim or that part of any claim
that could have been avoided or reduced if the Insured Person could have reasonably
minimized the costs incurred, or that is brought about or contributed to by the Insured
Person by failing to follow the directions, Medical Advice or guidance provided by a
Medical Practitioner.
Subcategory: Non-coverage due to insured person's actions
Annotation_Notes: Refers to situations where the insurer is not liable to pay for claims that could have been avoided or reduced by the insured person

Clause_Text:
The Sum Insured opted under the Policy shall be reduced by the amount payable
/ paid under the Policy terms and conditions and any optional covers applicable under
the Policy and only the balance shall be available as the Sum Insured for the
unexpired Policy Period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains how the Sum Insured amount can be reduced due to payouts under the policy terms, optional covers, and only the remaining amount will be available for the unexpired policy period.

Clause_Text:
If the Insured Person suffers a relapse within 45 days from the date of discharge
from the Hospital for which a claim has been made, then such relapse shall be
deemed to be part of the same claim and all the limits for “Any one illness” under
this Policy shall be applied as if they were under a single claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that if the insured person suffers a relapse within 45 days from the date of discharge from the hospital, it will be considered part of the same claim, and all the limits for 'Any one illness' under the policy will be applied as if they were under a single claim.

Clause_Text:
For Cashless claims, the payment shall be made to the Network Provider whose
discharge would be complete and final.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or ambiguity found

Clause_Text: For Reimbursement claims, the payment shall be made to the Insured Person.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerabilities or ambiguities found.

Clause_Text:
In
the unfortunate event of the Insured Person’s death, insurers will pay the Nominee
(as named in the Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance) and in case of no
Nominee, to the legal heir who holds a succession certificate or indemnity bond to
that effect, whichever is available and whose discharge shall be treated as full and
final discharge of insurer’s liability under the Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for payment of benefits in case of the insured person's death.
Key_Terms: ['Insured Person', 'Nominee', 'Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance', 'Legal heir', 'Succession certificate', 'Indemnity bond', 'Discharge', "Insurer's liability", 'Policy']

Clause_Text:
5.7 CONTRIBUTION:
i) If the Insured Person is covered under more than one Policy issued by the Company or
by any other Insurer, where such policies indemnify treatment cost, the Insured Person
shall have the right to require a settlement of his claim in terms of any of his policies,
provided the admissible claim is within the limits of and according to the terms of the
chosen policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the insured person's right to claim under multiple policies issued by the company or other insurers.
Key_Terms: ['Insured Person', 'More than one Policy', 'Company', 'Insurer', 'Treatment cost', 'Settlement of claim', 'Chosen policy', 'Admissible claim', 'Terms of the chosen policy']

Clause_Text:
ii) If the amount to be claimed exceeds the Sum Insured under a single Policy after
considering Deductibles or Co-payments, the Insured Person shall have the right to choose
Insurer by whom the claim is to be settled.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the right of the insured person to choose the insurer for claim settlement when the amount exceeds the Sum Insured.

Clause_Text:
In such cases the Company shall not be
liable to pay or contribute more than its rateable proportion of the admissible claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a limit on the company's liability in certain cases, which may lead to denial of claims.

Clause_Text:
iii) The Insured Person is duty bound to disclose such other insurance at the time of making
a claim under this policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the insured person's obligation to disclose any other existing insurance policies when making a claim under this health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
5.8 CLAIM FALLING IN TWO POLICY PERIODS:
If the claim event falls within two policy periods, the claims shall be paid taking into
consideration the available Sum Insured of the expiring Policy only.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to claims that fall within two policy periods, and specifies that only the available Sum Insured of the expiring Policy will be considered for payment.

Clause_Text:
Sum Insured of the Renewed Policy will not be available for the Hospitalisation
(including Pre & Post Hospitalisation Expenses), which has commenced in the
expiring Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause indicates that the sum insured is not available for hospitalization expenses that have started in the expiring policy.
Key_Terms: ['Sum Insured', 'Renewed Policy', 'Hospitalisation', 'Pre & Post Hospitalisation Expenses', 'Expiring Policy']

Clause_Text: Claim shall be settled on per event basis.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the method of claim settlement.

Clause_Text:
5.9 REPUDIATION/REJECTION OF CLAIM:
a) If Insurer, for any reasons, decides to reject a claim under the policy, insurer
shall communicate to the insured person in writing explicitly mentioning the
grounds for rejection/repudiation and within a period of 30 (thirty) days from the
receipt of the final document(s) or investigation report (if any), as the case may be.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for claim rejection by the insurer and the timeframe for communication of reasons.

Clause_Text:
b) Where a rejection is communicated by Insurer, the Insured Person may, if so
desired, within 15 days from the date of receipt of the claims decision represent to
insurer for reconsideration of the decision.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the process for the insured person to request a reconsideration of a claims decision within a specific timeframe.

Clause_Text:
d) If the insured is not satisfied with the reply of the Customer Service department
under 5.9 (c), he may approach the Insurance Ombudsman, established by the Central
Government for redressal of grievance.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for the insured to approach the Insurance Ombudsman for redressal of grievances if not satisfied with the reply of the Customer Service department under clause 5.9 (c).

Clause_Text:
The Insurance Ombudsman is empowered to
adjudicate on personal line insurance claims upto INR 20 Lacs.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the maximum claim amount that can be adjudicated by the Insurance Ombudsman for personal line health insurance.

Clause_Text:
5.10 DISCLAIMER OF CLAIM :
If the Company shall disclaim liability and communicate in writing (either through the
TPA or by itself) to the Insured in respect of any claim hereunder and such claim has
not within 12 calendar months from the date of such disclaimer been made the subject
matter of a suit in a Court of Law, then the claim shall for all purposes be deemed to
have been abandoned and shall not thereafter be recoverable hereunder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which the company can disclaim liability and the time frame within which the claim can be disputed in court.
Key_Terms: ['Company', 'Disclaimer of claim', '12 calendar months', 'Court of Law', 'Claim abandoned', 'Recoverable']

Clause_Text:
5.11 ARBITRATION CLAUSE :
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the arbitration process in case of disputes.

Clause_Text:
If any dispute or difference shall arise as to the quantum to be paid under the Policy
(liability being otherwise admitted) such difference shall independently of all other
questions be referred to the decision of a sole arbitrator to be appointed in writing by the
parties;
or
if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator within 30 days of any party invoking
arbitration, the same shall be referred to a panel of three arbitrators, comprising of two
arbitrators, one to be appointed by each of the parties to the dispute/difference and the
third arbitrator to be appointed by such two arbitrators and arbitration shall be
conducted under and in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and
Conciliation Act,1996.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for resolving disputes regarding the payment amount under the policy, in case liability is admitted. It specifies the use of a sole arbitrator or a panel of three arbitrators, appointed by the parties, and the arbitration process is to be conducted under the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.

Clause_Text:
It is clearly agreed and understood that no difference or dispute shall be referable to
arbitration as herein before provided, if the Company has disputed or not accepted
liability under or in respect of this policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that arbitration is not applicable if the company disputes or does not accept liability under the policy.

Clause_Text:
It is hereby expressly stipulated and declared that it shall be a condition precedent to
any right of action or suit upon this Policy that award by such arbitrator/ arbitrators of the
amount of the loss or damage shall be first obtained.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the condition that must be met before the policyholder can take legal action. It requires obtaining an award by an arbitrator or arbitrators regarding the amount of loss or damage.
Key_Terms: ['arbitrator', 'arbitrators', 'amount of the loss or damage', 'right of action or suit']

Clause_Text:
5.12 FRAUD :
If any claim made by the insured person, is in any respect fraudulent, or if any false
statement, or declaration is made or used in support thereof, or if any fraudulent
means or devices are used by the insured person or anyone acting on his/her behalf to
obtain any benefit under this policy, all benefits under this policy shall be forfeited.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences of making fraudulent claims or providing false statements in support of a claim.

Clause_Text:
Any amount already paid against claims made under the policy which are found
fraudulent later under this policy shall be repaid by all recipient(s)/policyholder(s),
who has made that particular claim, who shall be jointly and severally liable for such
repayment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the consequences for making fraudulent claims under the health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['Any amount already paid', 'fraudulent', 'claims', 'policyholder(s)', 'repayment', 'jointly and severally liable']

Clause_Text:
For the purpose of this clause, the expression "fraud" means any of the following acts
committed by the Insured Person or by his agent or the hospital/doctor/any other
party, with intent to deceive the insurer or to induce the insurer to issue an insurance
Policy:
(a) the suggestion, as a fact of that which is not true and which the Insured Person
does not believe to be true;
(b) the active concealment of a fact by the Insured Person having knowledge or belief
of the fact;
(c) any other act fitted to deceive; and
(d) any such act or omission as the law specially declares to be fraudulent
The company shall not repudiate the policy on the ground of fraud, if the insured
person / beneficiary can prove that the misstatement was true to the best of his
knowledge and there was no deliberate intention to suppress the fact or that such mis-
statement of or suppression of material fact are within the knowledge of the insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the concept of fraud and the conditions under which the insurance policy can be repudiated on the ground of fraud.

Clause_Text:
5.13 MEDICAL RECORDS :
a) The Insured Person hereby agrees to and authorizes the disclosure, to the Company/
TPA or any other person nominated by the Company, of any and all Medical records
and information held by any Institution / Hospital or Person from which the Insured Person
has obtained any medical or other treatment to the extent reasonably required by the
Company / TPA in connection with any claim made under this Policy or the Company’s
liability thereunder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the Insured Person's authorization for the disclosure of their medical records to the insurance company or third-party administrator (TPA) in case of a claim.

Clause_Text:
b) The Company / TPA agree that they will preserve the confidentiality of any
documentation and information that comes into their possession pursuant to (a) above and
will only use it in connection with any claim made under this Policy or the Company’s
liability thereunder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the obligations of the company and TPA to preserve confidentiality of documentation and information related to a claim under the policy.

Clause_Text:
c) Independent Medical Practitioner authorized by the Company / TPA shall be allowed to
examine the Insured Person in case of any Treatment/claim preferred under this policy ,when
and so often as the same may reasonably be required on behalf of the Company/TPA.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which an independent medical practitioner can examine the insured person in case of a claim.

Clause_Text:
5.14 CANCELLATION CLAUSE:
A) CANCELLATION BY INSURER:
The Company may cancel the Policy at any time on grounds of mis-represenation,
non-disclosure of material facts ,fraud by the Insured Person, by giving 15 days’
written notice.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the circumstances under which the insurer can cancel the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Cancellation', 'Insurer', 'Mis-representation', 'Non-disclosure of material facts', 'Fraud', "15 days' written notice"]

Clause_Text:
There would be no refund of premium on cancellation on grounds of
mis-represenation ,non-disclosure of material facts or fraud.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which no refund of premium will be given in case of misrepresentation, non-disclosure of material facts, or fraud.

Clause_Text:
B) CANCELLATION BY INSURED:
The Policyholder may cancel this Policy by giving 15days’ written notice, and in such an
event, the Company shall refund premium for the unexpired Policy Period as per the rates
detailed below :
PERIOD ON RISK RATE OF PREMIUM TO BE CHARGED
(RETAINED)
Up to one month 1/4th of the annual rate
Up to three months 1/2 of the annual rate
Up to six months 3/4th of the annual rate
Exceeding six months Full annual rate
Notwithstanding anything contained herein or otherwise, no refunds of premium shall
be made in respect of Cancellation where, any claim has been admitted or has been
lodged or any benefit has been availed by the Insured person under the Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions under which the policyholder can cancel the policy and the corresponding premium refund rates.
Key_Terms: ['Policyholder', '15 days’ written notice', 'unexpired Policy Period', 'premium', 'annual rate', 'Cancellation', 'claim', 'benefit']

require a settlement of his/her claim in terms of any of his/her policies.

cases the insurer if chosen by the policy holder shall be obliged to settle the claim as
long as the claim is within the limits of and according to the terms of the chosen
policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the insurer's obligation to settle a claim within the limits and terms of the chosen policy.

sum insured is not exhausted.

subject to the terms and conditions of this policy.

policyholder shall have the right to choose insurers from whom he/she wants to claim
the balance amount.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the policyholder's right to choose insurers for the balance amount when the claimed amount exceeds the sum insured under a single policy.

Clause_Text:

indemnity basis, the insured shall only be indemnified the hospitalization costs in
accordance with the terms and conditions of the chosen policy.

Clause_Text:
Preamble
This ‘Health Pulse’ policy is a contract of insurance between You and Us which is subject to payment of
full premium in advance and the terms, conditions and exclusions of this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the nature of the health insurance policy and the conditions under which it is valid.

Clause_Text:
This Policy has been
issued on the basis of the Disclosure to Information Norm, including the information provided by You in
the Proposal Form and the Information Summary Sheet.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the basis for issuing the policy, which includes the Disclosure to Information Norm and information provided by the policyholder.
Key_Terms: ['Disclosure to Information Norm', 'Policy Issuance', 'Proposal Form', 'Information Summary Sheet']

Clause_Text:
Please inform Us immediately of any change in the address or any other changes affecting You or any
Insured Person which would impact the benefits, terms and conditions under this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause requires the policyholder to inform the insurer of any changes in their personal information or circumstances that may affect the policy benefits, terms, and conditions.

Clause_Text: In addition, please note the list of exclusions is set out in Section 6 of this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause refers to a section in the policy document that lists the exclusions.

Clause_Text:
Definitions
For the purposes of interpretation and understanding of this Policy, We have defined some of the
important words used in the Policy which will have the special meaning accorded to these terms for the
purposes of this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause provides context for understanding the policy terms and their special meanings.

Clause_Text:
For the remaining language and words used, the usual meaning as described in
standard English language dictionaries shall apply.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the standard English language usage in the policy.

Clause_Text:
The words and expressions defined in the
Insurance Act 1938, IRDA Act 1999, regulations notified by the IRDAI and circulars and guidelines
issued by the IRDAI, together with their amendment shall carry the meanings given therein.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the meaning of certain terms used in the insurance document, based on the relevant acts, regulations, and guidelines.

Clause_Text:
Standard Definitions:
I.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines a term used in the policy.

Clause_Text:
Accident or Accidental means a sudden, unforeseen and involuntary event caused by external,
visible and violent means.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the term 'Accident or Accidental' in the context of health insurance.

Clause_Text:
AYUSH Treatment refers to the medical and / or hospitalization treatments given under Ayurveda,
Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Sidha and Homeopathy systems.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the type of treatments covered under the policy.

Clause_Text:
AYUSH Hospital:
An AYUSH Hospital is a healthcare facility wherein medical/surgical/para surgical treatment
procedures and interventions are carried out by AYUSH Medical Practitioner(s) comprising of any of
the following:
a.

b.

i.

Clause_Text:
Cancer means a malignant tumor characterized by the uncontrolled growth and spread of malignant
cells with invasion and destruction of normal tissues.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the term 'Cancer' for the purpose of health insurance coverage.

Clause_Text:
This diagnosis must be supported by histological
evidence of malignancy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition for coverage related to the diagnosis of a malignancy.

Clause_Text: The term cancer includes leukemia, lymphoma and sarcoma.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the types of cancer covered under the policy.

Clause_Text:
The following are excluded:
i.

All tumors which are histologically described as carcinoma in situ, benign, pre-malignant, borderline
malignant, low malignant potential, neoplasm of unknown behavior, or non-invasive, including but
not limited to: Carcinoma in situ of breasts, Cervical dysplasia CIN-1, CIN - 2 and CIN-3.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to specific types of cancer that are not invasive or malignant, but may have the potential to become malignant.

Clause_Text:
V. Cashless Facility means a facility extended by the insurer to the insured where the payments, of the
costs of treatment undergone by the insured in accordance with the policy terms and conditions, are
directly made to the network provider by the insurer to the extent pre-authorization is approved.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the cashless facility provided by the insurer to the insured for treatments under policy terms and conditions.

Clause_Text:
Congenital Anomaly means a condition which is present since birth, and which is abnormal with
reference to form, structure or position.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or exclusion mentioned

Internal Congenital Anomaly: Congenital Anomaly which is not in the visible and accessible parts of
the body.

Clause_Text:
External Congenital Anomaly: Congenital Anomaly which is in the visible and accessible parts of the
body.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to congenital anomalies that are visible and accessible.

Clause_Text:
Co-payment means a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the
Policyholder/insured will bear a specified percentage of the admissible claim amount.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability noted in this clause, but it does involve a cost-sharing requirement which could potentially be misleading if not well-understood.

Clause_Text:
A Co-payment
does not reduce the Sum Insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause clarifies that a co-payment does not affect the total amount of insurance coverage provided.

Clause_Text:
Cumulative Bonus means any increase or addition in the Sum Insured granted by the insurer
without an associated increase in premium

Clause_Text:
Day Care Treatment refers to medical treatment, and/or Surgical Procedure which is:
a. undertaken under General or Local Anaesthesia in a Hospital/Day Care Center in less than 24 hrs
because of technological advancement, and
b. which would have otherwise required a Hospitalization of more than 24 hours.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the definition of Day Care Treatment in the context of health insurance.
Key_Terms: ['Day Care Treatment', 'Medical treatment', 'Surgical Procedure', 'General or Local Anaesthesia', 'Hospital/Day Care Center', 'Hospitalization', 'Technological advancement']

Clause_Text: Treatment normally taken on an OPD basis is not included in the scope of this definition.
Annotation_Notes: This clause excludes treatment taken on an OPD basis from the coverage provided in the policy.

Clause_Text:
Dental Treatment means a treatment related to teeth or structures supporting teeth including
examinations, fillings (where appropriate), crowns, extractions and Surgery.
Annotation_Notes: The clause defines what dental treatment is covered under the policy.

Clause_Text:
Domiciliary Hospitalization means medical treatment for an Illness/disease/Injury which in the
normal course would require care and treatment at a Hospital but is actually taken while confined at
home under any of the following circumstances:
a. the condition of the patient is such that he/she is not in a condition to be removed to a Hospital, or
b. the patient takes treatment at home on account of non availability of room in a Hospital.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the conditions for Domiciliary Hospitalization, which is a type of medical treatment that can be received at home instead of a hospital.

Clause_Text:
Emergency means a medical condition or symptom resulting from Illness or Injury which arises
suddenly and unexpectedly and requires immediate care and treatment by a Medical Practitioner to
prevent death or serious long term impairment of the Insured Person’s health.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the term 'Emergency' in the context of health insurance
Key_Terms: ['Emergency', 'Medical Condition', 'Illness', 'Injury', 'Insured Person', 'Medical Practitioner', 'Prevent death', 'Serious long term impairment']

Clause_Text:
Grace Period means the specified period of time immediately following the premium due date during
which a payment can be made to Renew or continue a policy in force without loss of continuity benefits
such as Waiting Periods and coverage of Pre-existing Diseases.
Annotation_Notes: The clause explains the Grace Period, which allows for continued policy coverage without loss of benefits like Waiting Periods and coverage for Pre-existing Diseases, even if the premium payment is made after the due date.

Clause_Text:
Coverage is not available for the
period for which no premium is received.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition under which coverage is not provided, i.e., when no premium is received.
Defines the criteria for a hospital to be considered for coverage under the policy

ICU (Intensive Care Unit) Charges means the amount charged by a Hospital towards ICU expenses
which shall include the expenses for ICU bed, general medical support services provided to any ICU
patient including monitoring devices, critical care nursing and intensivist charges.

Clause_Text:
Illness means a sickness or a disease or pathological condition leading to the impairment of normal
physiological function and requires medical treatment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the term 'Illness' in the context of health insurance.

Clause_Text:
(a) Acute condition - Acute condition is a disease, illness or injury that is likely to respond quickly
to treatment which aims to return the person to his or her state of health immediately before
suffering the disease/ illness/ injury which leads to full recovery
(b) Chronic condition - A chronic condition is defined as a disease, illness, or injury that has one
or more of the following characteristics:
i. it needs ongoing or long-term monitoring through consultations, examinations, check-ups,
and /or tests
ii.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the characteristics of acute and chronic conditions in the context of health insurance

Clause_Text:
it needs ongoing or long-term control or relief of symptoms
iii.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to a condition requiring ongoing or long-term control or relief of symptoms.

Clause_Text:
it requires rehabilitation for the patient or for the patient to be specially trained to cope with it
iv.
Annotation_Notes: The clause pertains to the requirement for rehabilitation or special training for the patient.

Clause_Text:
it continues indefinitely
v. it recurs or is likely to recur
XIX.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the continuation of coverage for recurring conditions.

Clause_Text:
Injury means Accidental physical bodily harm excluding Illness or disease solely and directly caused

Practitioner.
Annotation_Notes: The clause excludes illness or disease from the definition of injury.

Clause_Text:
Intensive Care Unit means an identified section, ward or wing of a Hospital which is under the
constant supervision of a dedicated Medical Practitioner(s), and which is specially equipped for the
continuous monitoring and treatment of patients who are in a critical condition, or require life support
facilities and where the level of care and supervision is considerably more sophisticated and intensive
than in the ordinary and other wards.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) as a specialized section of a hospital for critically ill patients requiring life support and intensive care.
Key_Terms: ['Intensive Care Unit', 'critical condition', 'life support facilities', 'dedicated Medical Practitioner(s)', 'continuous monitoring', 'ordinary wards']

Clause_Text:
Inpatient Care means treatment for which the Insured Person has to stay in a Hospital for more than

Clause_Text:
Medical Advice means any consultation or advice from a Medical Practitioner including the issuance
of any prescription or follow-up prescription.

Clause_Text:
Medical Expenses means those expenses that an Insured Person has necessarily and actually
incurred for medical treatment on account of Illness or Accident on the advice of a Medical
Practitioner, as long as these are no more than would have been payable if the Insured Person had
not been insured and no more than other Hospitals or doctors in the same locality would have charged
for the same medical treatment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the scope of medical expenses covered under the insurance policy, specifying that the expenses must be necessary, actually incurred for medical treatment on account of illness or accident, and must not exceed what would have been payable if the insured person was not insured and what other hospitals or doctors in the same locality would have charged for the same medical treatment.

Clause_Text:
Medical Practitioner means a person who holds a valid registration from the Medical Council of any
State or Medical Council of India or Council for Indian Medicine or for Homeopathy set up by the
Government of India or a State Government and is thereby entitled to practice medicine within its
jurisdiction; and is acting within the scope and jurisdiction of his licence.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the qualifications required for a medical practitioner to be eligible for coverage under the policy.

Clause_Text:

a.

existing Hospital to another Hospital with advanced facilities as advised by the treating Medical

Clause_Text:
No Claim Bonus

a.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the No Claim Bonus policy in the health insurance document.

Clause_Text:
If the Policy is Renewed with Us without a break or if the Policy continues to be in force for the 2nd
Policy Year in the 2 year / 3 year Policy Period respectively (if applicable) and no claim has been
made in the immediately preceding Policy Year, then for every claim free Policy Year, We will
increase the Sum Insured applicable under the Policy by 10% of the Base Sum Insured of the
immediately preceding Policy Year subject to a maximum of 100% of the Base Sum Insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the increase in Sum Insured based on claim-free policy years.

decrease the Sum Insured due to this benefit for the Policy Year.

Post reduction in the Base Sum Insured and the accumulated No Claim Bonus, if

Post increase in the Base Sum Insured and the accumulated No Claim Bonus, if

What is covered:
If the Base Sum Insured and accumulated No Claim Bonus (if any) has been partially or completely
exhausted due to claims made and paid or accepted as payable, for any Illness / Injury during the
Policy Year under Section 3, then We will provide a Re-fill amount of maximum up to 100% of the Base
Sum Insured (excluding No Claim Bonus) which may be utilized for claims arising in that Policy Year,
subject to the conditions mentioned below.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reimbursement of benefits in case the base sum insured and accumulated no claim bonus have been partially or completely exhausted due to claims during the policy year, under certain conditions.

Policy Document

Clause_Text:
Optional Benefits
The following optional benefits shall apply under the Policy only if it is specified in the Policy Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which optional benefits apply in the policy.

Clause_Text:
Optional benefits can be selected by You only at the time of issuance of the First Policy or at Renewal
(unless otherwise specified) on payment of the corresponding additional premium.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to optional benefits that can be added to the policy

Clause_Text:
Policy Document
The optional benefits ‘Personal Accident Cover’, ‘Critical Illness Cover’ and ‘Hospital Cash’ will be
payable (only on Reimbursement basis) if the conditions mentioned in the below sections are
contracted or sustained by the Insured Person covered under these optional benefits during the Policy
Period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the conditions for the payment of optional benefits under the health insurance policy
Key_Terms: ['Personal Accident Cover', 'Critical Illness Cover', 'Hospital Cash', 'Reimbursement basis', 'Policy Period']

Clause_Text:
The applicable optional benefits will be payable subject to the terms, conditions and exclusions of this
Policy and subject always to any sub-limits for the optional benefit as specified in the Policy Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which optional benefits are payable

Clause_Text:
All claims for any applicable optional benefits under the Policy must be made in accordance with the
process defined under Section 7.2 (XI) (Claim Process & Requirements).
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the process for making claims under optional benefits.

Clause_Text:
Personal Accident Cover
What is covered:
This optional benefit is available either to the Primary Insured Person or Primary Insured Person along
with his/her spouse, which is specified in the Policy Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the Personal Accident Cover benefit available to the Primary Insured Person or Primary Insured Person's spouse.

Clause_Text:
If the Insured Person covered under this optional benefit dies or sustains any Injury resulting solely and
directly from an Accident occurring during the Policy Period at any location worldwide, and while the
Policy is in force, We will provide the benefits described below.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the conditions for receiving death benefits in case of an accident during the policy period.
Key_Terms: ['Insured Person', 'Optional Benefit', 'Death', 'Injury', 'Accident', 'Policy Period', 'Benefits', 'Worldwide', 'Policy is in force']

Clause_Text:
4.1.1 Accident Death (AD)
What is covered:
If the Injury due to Accident solely and directly results in the Insured Person’s death within 365 days
from the occurrence of the Accident, We will make payment of Personal Accident Cover Sum
Insured specified in the Policy Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which death due to an accident is covered under the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Accident Death (AD)', 'Injury', 'Insured Person’s death', '365 days', 'Occurrence of the Accident', 'Personal Accident Cover Sum Insured', 'Policy Schedule']

Clause_Text:
If a claim is made under this optional benefit, the coverage
for that Insured Person under the Policy shall immediately and automatically cease.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that if a claim is made under an optional benefit, the coverage for the insured person under the policy will immediately cease.

Clause_Text:
Any claim
incurred before death of such Insured person shall be admissible subject to terms and conditions
under this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the admissibility of claims incurred before the death of the insured person, subject to the terms and conditions under the policy.

Clause_Text:
4.1.2 Accident Permanent Total Disability (APTD)
What is covered:
If the Injury due to Accident solely and directly results in the Permanent Total Disability of the
Insured Person which means that the Injury results in one or more of the following conditions within
365 days from the occurrence of an Accident, We will make payment of 125% of the Personal
Accident Cover Sum Insured as specified in the Policy Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage for Permanent Total Disability due to an accident as per the policy
Key_Terms: ['Accident Permanent Total Disability', 'Injury', 'Insured Person', '125% of the Personal Accident Cover Sum Insured', '365 days', 'Policy Schedule']

Clause_Text:
Loss of use of limbs or sight
The Insured Person suffers from total and irrecoverable loss of:
I.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of loss of use of limbs or sight, which could be considered a significant event impacting the insured person's quality of life.
Key_Terms: ['Loss of use of limbs or sight', 'Insured Person', 'total and irrecoverable loss']

Clause_Text:
The use of two limbs (including paraplegia and hemiplegia) OR
II.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of specific conditions related to the use of two limbs, including paraplegia and hemiplegia.

Clause_Text:
The sight in both eyes OR
III.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirement for coverage of sight-related issues in both eyes.

Clause_Text:
The use of one limb and the sight in one eye
2.

Clause_Text:
Loss of independent living
The Insured Person is permanently unable to perform independently three or more of the following
six activities of daily living.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to the inability of the insured person to perform certain daily living activities, which may trigger a disability benefit.
Key_Terms: ['Loss of independent living', 'Insured Person', 'Permanently unable', 'Activities of daily living']

Clause_Text:
Washing: the ability to maintain an adequate level of cleanliness and personal
hygiene.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the policyholder's ability to maintain personal hygiene, which may be relevant to certain health conditions or treatments.

Clause_Text:
Dressing: the ability to put on and take off all necessary garments, artificial limbs or
other surgical appliances that are medically necessary.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of dressing-related needs due to medical necessity.

Clause_Text:
Feeding: the ability to transfer food from a plate or bowl to the mouth once food has
been prepared and made available.
Annotation_Notes: This clause refers to the ability to feed oneself, which is a common daily living activity covered under many health insurance policies.

Clause_Text:
Toileting: the ability to manage bowel and bladder function, maintaining an adequate
and socially acceptable level of hygiene.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or risk mentioned, but this clause pertains to a health-related benefit.

Clause_Text:
V. Mobility: the ability to move indoors from room to room on level surfaces at the normal
place of residence.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability mentioned
Key_Terms: ['Mobility', 'ability', 'move indoors', 'room to room', 'level surfaces', 'normal place of residence']

Clause_Text:
Transferring: the ability to move from a lying position in a bed to a sitting position in an
upright chair or wheel chair and vice versa.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of assistance for moving from a lying position to a sitting position and vice versa.

continues for a period of at least 6 continuous calendar months from the commencement of

limbs etc; and

Section 4.1.1 (Accident Death) subject to terms and conditions mentioned therein; and
4.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that no amount will be paid under the optional benefit if the insured person dies before a claim is admitted. The claim will be considered under Section 4.1.1 (Accident Death) subject to terms and conditions mentioned therein.

Clause_Text:
We will not make payment under Accident Permanent Total Disability more than once in the
Insured Person’s lifetime for any and all Policy Periods.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that the insurer will not make multiple payments for Accident Permanent Total Disability throughout the insured person's lifetime, regardless of the policy period.

Clause_Text:
If a claim under this optional benefit is admitted, then coverage for the Insured Person will
immediately and automatically cease under Section 4.1 (Personal Accident Cover) and this
optional benefit shall not be applied in respect of that Insured Person on any Renewal
thereafter.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that if a claim under an optional health insurance benefit is admitted, the coverage for the insured person will immediately cease under a specific section related to personal accident cover. This exclusion applies to that insured person on any renewal thereafter.

Clause_Text:
However, other applicable benefits can be Renewed in respect of the Insured
Person.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability noted, but it's important to clarify the conditions for renewal.

Clause_Text:
4.1.3 Accident Permanent Partial Disability (APPD)
What is covered:
If the Injury due to Accident solely and directly results in the Permanent Partial Disability of the
Insured Person which is of the nature specified in the table below within 365 days from the
occurrence of such Accident, We will make payment under this optional benefit in accordance with
the table below:
Conditions - The above coverage is subject to fulfilment of following conditions:
1.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the coverage for Accident Permanent Partial Disability (APPD) under the health insurance policy, with a waiting period of 365 days from the accident occurrence. The coverage amount is determined by the table provided.

Clause_Text:
The Permanent Partial Disability is proved through a disability certificate issued by a Medical
Board duly constituted by the Central and/or the State Government; and
2.

We will admit a claim under this optional benefit only if the Permanent Partial Disability

Clause_Text:
If the Insured Person dies before a claim has been admitted under this optional benefit, no
amount will be payable under this optional benefit, however We will consider the claim under
Section 4.1.1 (Accident Death) subject to the terms and conditions mentioned therein.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the situation when the insured person dies before a claim has been admitted under the optional benefit, and no amount will be payable under this optional benefit. However, the claim will be considered under Section 4.1.1 (Accident Death) subject to the terms and conditions mentioned therein.

Clause_Text:
If a claim under this optional benefit has been admitted, then no further claim in respect of the
same condition will be admitted under this optional benefit.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to multiple claims for the same condition under an optional benefit

Clause_Text:
If a claim under this optional benefit is paid and the entire Personal Accident Sum Insured
specified in the Policy Schedule does not get utilized, then the balance Personal Accident
Cover Sum Insured shall be available for further claims under Section 4.1 (Personal Accident
Cover) until the entire Personal Accident Cover Sum Insured is consumed.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the conditions under which a benefit can be claimed multiple times if the entire sum insured is not utilized in the first claim.
Key_Terms: ['claim', 'Personal Accident Sum Insured', 'Policy Schedule', 'Section 4.1', 'Personal Accident Cover', 'balance Personal Accident Cover Sum Insured', 'consumed']

Clause_Text:
The Personal
Accident Cover Sum Insured specified in the first Policy Schedule shall be a lifetime limit for the
Insured Person and once this limit is exhausted, coverage for the Insured Person will
immediately and automatically cease under Section 4.1 (Personal Accident Cover) and this
optional benefit shall not be applied in respect of that Insured Person on any Renewal
thereafter.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a lifetime limit for the Personal Accident Cover Sum Insured under the policy.

Clause_Text:
Critical Illness Cover
What is covered:
This optional benefit is available either to the Primary Insured Person or Primary Insured Person along
with his/her spouse, which is specified in the Policy Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the covered benefits for the Critical Illness Cover

Clause_Text:
If the Insured Person covered under this optional benefit is diagnosed for the first time with any of the
following listed Critical Illnesses or if any of the following Critical Illnesses occurs or manifests itself in
the Insured Person during the Policy Period for the first time, We will pay the Critical Illness Sum
Insured specified in the Policy Schedule provided that the Insured Person survives the Survival Period
of 30 days from the diagnosis of the Critical Illness during the Policy Period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions for payout in case of a first-time diagnosis of a critical illness during the policy period.
Key_Terms: ['Insured Person', 'Critical Illness', 'Critical Illness Sum Insured', 'Policy Period', 'Survival Period', 'Diagnosis']

Clause_Text:
Muscular Dystrophy
I.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of Muscular Dystrophy.

Clause_Text:
Muscular Dystrophy is a disease of the muscle causing progressive and permanent
weakening of certain muscle groups.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the nature of Muscular Dystrophy, a specific disease covered under the health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
The diagnosis of Muscular Dystrophy must be made
by a consultant neurologist, and confirmed with the appropriate laboratory, biochemical,
histological, and electromyography evidence.
Annotation_Notes: Requires specific diagnostic procedures for Muscular Dystrophy

Clause_Text:
The disease must result in the permanent
inability of the Insured Person to perform (whether aided or unaided) at least three (3) of
the six (6)“Activities of Daily Living”.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for coverage related to the permanent inability of the insured person to perform certain activities of daily living.

Clause_Text:
Activities of Daily Living are defined as:
a.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the term 'Activities of Daily Living' in the context of health insurance.

Clause_Text:
Washing : the ability to maintain an adequate level of cleanliness and personal
hygiene
b. Dressing : the ability to put on and take off all necessary garments, artificial limbs or
other surgical appliances that are Medically Necessary
c. Feeding : the ability to transfer food from a plate or bowl to the mouth once food has
been prepared and made available
d. Toileting : the ability to manage bowel and bladder function, maintaining an adequate
and socially acceptable level of hygiene
e. Mobility : the ability to move indoors from room to room on level surfaces at the normal
place of residence
f. Transferring: the ability to move from a lying position in a bed to a sitting position in an
upright chair or wheel chair and vice versa
20.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the six Activities of Daily Living (ADL) that are covered by the health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
4.3. e-Consultation
What is covered:
If the Insured Person is diagnosed with an Illness or is planning to undergo a planned Surgery or a
Surgical Procedure, the Insured Person can, at the Insured Person’s sole discretion, obtain an e-
Consultation during the Policy Period.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies a benefit for the insured person to avail e-consultation in certain conditions.
Key_Terms: ['Insured Person', 'e-Consultation', 'Diagnosed with an Illness', 'Planned Surgery', 'Surgical Procedure']

Clause_Text:
Conditions - The above coverage is subject to fulfilment of following conditions:
a. e-Consultation shall be requested through Our call centre or website chat.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition for the e-Consultation coverage.

Clause_Text:
b. e-Consultation will be arranged by Us (without any liabilities) and will be based solely on the
information provided by the Insured Person.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the arrangement of e-consultations for the insured person, specifying that the insurer assumes no liability for the arrangement.

Clause_Text:
Policy Document
c. e-Consultation must not be considered a substitute to medical opinion or advise nor shall be same
pursued over a medical advice or opinion given by treating physician or doctor
d. By seeking e-Consultation under this benefit, the Insured Person is not prohibited or advised
against visiting or consulting with any other independent Medical Practitioner or commencing or
continuing any treatment advised by such Medical Practitioner.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies that e-Consultation is not a substitute for medical advice or opinion from a treating physician or doctor, and the Insured Person is not prohibited or advised against visiting or consulting with any other independent Medical Practitioner.

Clause_Text:
e. The Insured Person is free to choose whether or not to obtain the e-Consultation, and if obtained
then whether or not to act on it in whole or in part.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the Insured Person's right to choose e-Consultation services and act on them as they see fit.

Clause_Text: f. e-Consultation under this benefit shall not be valid for any medico-legal purposes.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the usage of e-Consultation under the health insurance benefit and its lack of validity for medico-legal purposes.

Clause_Text:
g. We do not represent correctness of e-Consultation and shall not assume or deem to assume any
liability towards any loss or damage arising out of or in relation to any opinion, advice, prescription,
actual or alleged errors, omissions and representations made by the Medical Practitioner.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the insurance company's disclaimers regarding e-consultations and the medical practitioner's opinions, advice, prescriptions, and potential errors.

Clause_Text:
Personal Waiting Periods
Conditions specified for an Insured Person under Personal Waiting Period in the Policy Schedule will be
subject to a Waiting Period of 48 months from the inception of the First Policy with Us for that Insured
Person and will be covered from the commencement of the fifth Policy Year for that Insured Person as
long as the Insured Person has been insured continuously under the Policy without any break.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the duration for which certain conditions specified for an insured person under Personal Waiting Period in the Policy Schedule will be subject to a Waiting Period of 48 months from the inception of the First Policy with Us for that Insured Person and will be covered from the commencement of the fifth Policy Year for that Insured Person as long as the Insured Person has been insured continuously under the Policy without any break.

any of the following:
a.

Clause_Text:

Clause_Text:
Renewal of Policy
The policy shall ordinarily be renewable except on grounds of fraud,
misrepresentation by the insured person.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which the policy can be non-renewed.

Clause_Text: The Company shall endeavor to give notice for renewal.

Clause_Text:
However, the Company is
not under obligation to give any notice for renewal.

Renewal shall not be denied on the ground that the insured person had made a
claim or claims in the preceding policy years.

Request for renewal along with requisite premium shall be received by the

ln the event of death of the policyholder, the Company will pay the nominee {as
named in the Policy Schedule/Policy Certificate/Endorsement (if any)} and in case
there is no subsisting nominee, to the legal heirs or legal representatives of the
policyholder whose discharge shall be treated as full and final discharge of its liability
under the policy.
Annotation_Notes: The clause describes the procedure for paying out benefits in the event of the policyholder's death.

Clause_Text:
V. Fraud
lf any claim made by the insured person, is in any respect fraudulent, or if any false
statement, or declaration is made or used in support thereof, or if any fraudulent
means or devices are used by the insured person or anyone acting on his/her behalf
to obtain any benefit under this policy, all benefits under this policy and the premium
paid shall be forfeited.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences for fraudulent claims made by the insured person.

Clause_Text:
Any amount already paid against claims made under this policy but which are found
fraudulent later shall be repaid by all recipient(s)/policyholder(s), who has made that
particular claim, who shall be jointly and severally liable for such repayment to the
insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the consequences of making a fraudulent claim under the policy.

Clause_Text:
For the purpose of this clause, the expression "fraud" means any of the following acts
committed by the insured person or by his agent or the hospital/doctor/any other party
acting on behalf of the insured person, with intent to deceive the insurer or to induce
the insurer to issue an insurance policy: a) the suggestion, as a fact of that which is
not true and which the insured person does not believe to be true; b) the active
concealment of a fact by the insured person having knowledge or belief of the fact; c)
any other act fitted to deceive; and d) any such act or omission as the law specially
declares to be fraudulent
The Company shall not repudiate the claim and / or forfeit the policy benefits on the
ground of Fraud, if the insured person / beneficiary can prove that the misstatement
was true to the best of his knowledge and there was no deliberate intention to

Clause_Text:
ln the case of delay in the payment of a claim, the Company shall be liable to
pay interest to the policyholder from the date of receipt of last necessary
document to the date of payment of claim at a rate 2% above the bank rate.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the interest rate that the insurance company will pay to the policyholder if there is a delay in the payment of a claim.

Clause_Text:
However, where the circumstances of a claim warrant an investigation in the
opinion of the Company, it shall initiate and complete such investigation at the
earliest, in any case not later than 30 days from the date of receipt of last
necessary document- ln such cases, the Company shall settle or reject the
claim within 45 days from the date of receipt of last necessary document.

interest to the policyholder at a rate 2% above the bank rate from the date of
receipt of last necessary document to the date of payment of claim.

Clause_Text:

Clause_Text:
The maximum risk
loading applicable shall not exceed 50%.

Clause_Text:
These loadings will be applied from inception date of the First Policy including subsequent
Renewal(s) with Us.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the duration for which the loading will be applied.

c. If a loading applies to the premium for the main Policy, such loading will also apply to the premium
for the optional benefits selected except under Section 4.1 (Personal Accident Cover) and Section
4.3 (e-Consultation).
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the application of loading on the premium for the main policy and optional benefits, with exceptions for Personal Accident Cover and e-Consultation.

i.

The Policy shall automatically terminate in the event of death of the Insured Person.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the termination of the policy in the event of the death of the insured person.

Clause_Text:
For Family Floater Policies:
The Policy shall automatically terminate in the event of the death of all the Insured Persons.

Person.

considering such Policy Year as the first year of the Policy with Us.

Clause_Text:
V. Obligations in case of a minor
If an Insured Person is less than 18 years of Age, You or another adult Insured Person or legal
guardian (in case of Your and all other adult Insured Person’s demise) shall be completely responsible
for ensuring compliance with all the terms and conditions of this Policy on behalf of that minor Insured
Person.

We must be contacted to pre-authorize Cashless Facility for planned treatment at least 72

b. PREAMBLE
ICICI Lombard General Insurance Company Limited (“We / Us”), having received a Proposal and
the premium from the Proposer named in Part a of the Policy (hereinafter referred to as the “Policy
Schedule”) and the said Proposal and Declaration together with any statement, report or other
document leading to the issue of this Policy and referred to therein having been accepted and
agreed to by Us and the Proposer as the basis of this contract do, by this Policy agree, in
consideration of and subject to the due receipt of the subsequent premiums, as set out in the Policy
Schedule, and further, subject to the terms and conditions contained in this Policy that on proof to
Our satisfaction of the compensation having become payable as set out in the Policy Schedule to
the title of the said person or persons claiming payment or upon the happening of an event upon
which one or more benefits become payable under this Policy, the Annual Sum Insured /
appropriate benefit amount will be paid by Us.

plural and references to any gender shall include references to all genders.

Further any
references to statutory enactment include subsequent changes to the same.
Annotation_Notes: This clause clarifies the scope of the policy by including subsequent changes to the statutory enactment.

Clause_Text:
Standard Definitions (Definitions whose wordings are specified by IRDAI)
Accident means a sudden, unforeseen and involuntary event caused by external, visible and violent
means.

Any one illness means continuous Period of illness and it includes relapse within 45 days from the
date of last consultation with the Hospital/Nursing Home where treatment may have been taken.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the term 'Any one illness' in the context of the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Any one illness', 'Continuous Period of illness', 'Relapse', '45 days', 'Hospital/Nursing Home']

Clause_Text:
Ayush Hospital is a healthcare facility wherein medical/surgical/para-surgical treatment procedures
and interventions are carried out by AYUSH Medical practitioner(s) comprising of any of the following:
a) Central or State government AYUSH hospital; or
b) Teaching hospital attached to AYUSH college recognized by the central government/Central
council of Indian medicine/ Central council for Homeopathy; or
c) AYUSH Hospital, standalone or co-located with in-patient healthcare facility of any
recognized system of medicine, registered with the local authorities, wherever applicable,
and is under the supervision of a qualified registered AYUSH medical practitioner and must
comply with the following criterion:
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the types of hospitals covered under the policy for AYUSH treatment.
Key_Terms: ['Ayush Hospital', 'medical/surgical/para-surgical treatment', 'AYUSH Medical practitioner', 'Central or State government AYUSH hospital', 'Teaching hospital', 'AYUSH college', 'Central council of Indian medicine/ Central council for Homeopathy', 'AYUSH Hospital', 'local authorities', 'registered', 'supervision', 'qualified registered AYUSH medical practitioner', 'criterion']

Clause_Text:
Having at least 5 in-patient beds
ii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the minimum number of in-patient beds required for a facility to be eligible for coverage.

Clause_Text:
Having qualified AYUSH medical practitioner in charge round the clock
iii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the availability of an Ayurveda medical practitioner for round-the-clock care.
Refers to the requirement for AYUSH therapy sections and equipped operation theatres for surgical procedures.

Clause_Text:
ICICI Lombard Complete Health Insurance Annexure I
UIN - ICIHLIP22096V062122
AYUSH Day Care Centre means and includes Community Health Centre (CHC), Primary Health
Centre (PHC), Dispensary, Clinic, Polyclinic or any such health centre which is registered with the
local authorities, wherever applicable and having facilities for carrying out treatment procedures and
medical or surgical/para-surgical interventions or both under the supervision of registered AYUSH
Medical Practitioner (s) on day care basis without in- patient services and must comply with all the
following criterion:
a) Having qualified registered AYUSH Medical Practitioner(s) in charge;
b) Having dedicated AYUSH therapy sections as required and/or has equipped operation
theatre where surgical procedures are to be carried out;
c) Maintaining daily records of the patients and making them accessible to the insurance
company’s authorized representative.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the facilities covered under the policy for AYUSH Day Care Centre treatments.
