Clause_Text:
Condition Precedent shall mean a policy term or condition upon which the Insurer's liability under
the policy is conditional upon.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines a term used in the policy.

Clause_Text:
Congenital Anomaly refers to a condition(s) which is present since birth, and which is abnormal with
reference to form, structure or position.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines a pre-existing condition related to congenital anomalies.

Clause_Text:
a) Internal Congenital Anomaly -Congenital anomaly which is not in the visible and accessible
parts of the body
b) External Congenital Anomaly- Congenital anomaly which is in the visible and accessible
parts of the body
Co-payment means a cost sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that
the policyholder/insured/proposer will bear a specified percentage of the admissible claims amount.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the types of congenital anomalies and the concept of co-payment

Clause_Text: A co-payment does not reduce the Sum Insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause clarifies that the co-payment does not affect the total amount of insurance coverage provided.

Clause_Text:
Cumulative Bonus shall mean any increase or addition in the Sum Insured granted by the insurer
without an associated increase in premium.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the definition of Cumulative Bonus in the context of health insurance, which refers to an increase or addition in the Sum Insured granted by the insurer without an associated increase in premium.

Clause_Text:
Day care centre means any institution established for day care treatment of illness and/or injuries or
a medical setup with a hospital and which has been registered with the local authorities, wherever
applicable, and is under supervision of a registered and qualified medical practitioner AND must
comply with all minimum criterion as under –
a) has qualified nursing staff under its employment;
b) has qualified medical practitioner/s in charge
c) has fully equipped operation theatre of its own where surgical procedures are carried out;
d) maintains daily records of patients and will make these accessible to the insurance
company’s authorized personnel
Day Care Treatment refers to medical treatment, and/or Surgical Procedure which is
a) undertaken under General or Local Anesthesia in a Hospital/Day care centre in less than 24
hrs because of technological advancement, and
b) which would have otherwise required a hospitalisation of more than 24 hours.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the criteria for a day care centre and the conditions for day care treatment.
Key_Terms: ['Day care centre', 'Day Care Treatment', 'Hospital', 'Local authorities', 'Registered medical practitioner', 'Nursing staff', 'Operation theatre', 'Surgical procedures', 'Daily records', 'Insurance company', 'General or Local Anesthesia', 'Hospitalization', 'Technological advancement']

Clause_Text: Treatment normally taken on an out-patient basis is not included in the scope of this definition.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a type of medical service not covered by the policy.

Clause_Text:
ICICI Lombard Complete Health Insurance Annexure I
UIN - ICIHLIP22096V062122
Deductible is a cost sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that provides
that the insurer will not be liable for specified rupee amount in case of indemnity policies and for a
specified number of days/hours in case of hospital cash policy, which will apply before any benefits
are payable by the insurer This is to clarify that a deductible does not reduce the sum insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the concept of a deductible in health insurance policies, its purpose, and clarifies that it does not reduce the sum insured.
Key_Terms: ['Deductible', 'Cost sharing requirement', 'Indemnity policies', 'Hospital cash policy', 'Specified rupee amount', 'Specified number of days/hours', 'Sum insured']

Clause_Text:
Dental treatment means a treatment related to teeth or structures supporting teeth including
examinations, fillings (where appropriate), crowns, extractions and surgery
Disclosure to information Norm means the policy shall be void and all premium paid thereon shall
be forfeited to the Company in the event of misrepresentation, mis-description or non-disclosure of
any material fact
Domiciliary Hospitalisation means medical treatment for an illness/disease/injury which in the
normal course would require care and treatment at a hospital but is actually taken while confined at
home under any of the following circumstances:
a) the condition of the patient is such that he/she is not in a condition to be removed to a hospital,
or
b) the patient takes treatment at home on account of non-availability of room in a hospital.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the scope of dental treatment covered under the health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
Emergency Care means management for an illness or injury which results in symptoms which occur
suddenly and unexpectedly, and requires immediate care by a medical practitioner to prevent death
or serious long term impairment of the insured person’s health
Grace Period means the specified period of time immediately following the premium due date during
which a payment can be made to renew or continue a policy in force without loss of continuity benefits

Clause_Text:
Reset Benefit
For plans with Sum Insured ₹ 3lacs and above, We will reset up to 100% of the Sum insured
once in a policy year in case the Sum insured including accrued Additional Sum Insured (if any)
is insufficient as a result of previous claims in that policy year, provided that:
 The total amount of reset will not exceed the Sum Insured for that policy year
 The reset amount can only be used for all future claims within the same policy year,
not related to the illness/disease/injury for which a claim has been paid in that policy
year for the same person
 The claim will be admissible under the reset only if the claim is admissible as per
section “benefits covered under the policy” in part d of Policy Schedule.

Clause_Text:
Personal Accident cover
In consideration of the payment of additional premium to Us, it is hereby declared and
agreed that notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the Policy, We will pay You or Your
Nominee / legal heir, as the case may be, the sum insured as specified against this
Extension in the Policy Schedule, on occurrence of any Insured Event, as specifically
described hereunder, arising due to an Injury sustained by You during the Policy Year:
 Insured Event – Accidental Death
We will pay Your Nominee / legal heir, as the case may be, the sum insured as
specified against this Extension in the Policy Schedule, on the unfortunate event
of Your death, provided such death results solely and directly from an Injury
sustained within a period of twelve months from the date of Accident resulting in
such Injury.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions under which a death benefit will be paid in the event of an accident during the policy year.

hazard identification

e) Pandemic preparedness in terms of providing necessary drugs and equipment to
protect the insured
Payment of Claims
The reimbursement of claims under this extension shall be done only once per insured
member during each Policy Year of the Policy Period.

city/location.

E.1 Code- Excl01: Pre-Existing Diseases

complications shall be excluded until the expiry of 24 months3 of continuous coverage
after the date of inception of the first policy with insurer.

subject to the same being declared at the time of application and accepted by Insurer.

Code- Excl06: Obesity/ Weight Control
Expenses related to the surgical treatment of obesity that does not fulfil all the below
conditions:
1) Surgery to be conducted is upon the advice of the Doctor
2) The surgery/Procedure conducted should be supported by clinical protocols
3) The member has to be 18 years of age or older and
4) Body Mass Index (BMI);
5) greater than or equal to 40 or
6) greater than or equal to 35 in conjunction with any of the following severe co-
morbidities following failure of less invasive methods of weight loss:
o Obesity-related cardiomyopathy
o Coronary heart disease
o Severe Sleep Apnea
o Uncontrolled Type2 Diabetes

take informed decision in the context of underwriting the risk)

Fraud

used by the insured person or anyone acting on his/her behalf to obtain any benefit under this
policy, all benefits under this policy and the premium paid shall be forfeited.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences of making fraudulent claims or providing false information in support of a claim.

Clause_Text:
Any amount already paid against claims made under this policy but which are found fraudulent
later shall be repaid by all recipient(s)/policyholder(s) who has made that particular claim,,
who shall be jointly and severally liable for such repayment to the insurer
For the purpose of this clause, the expression "fraud" means any of the following acts
committed by the Insured Person or by his agent or the hospital/doctor/any other party acting
on behalf of the insured person, with intent to deceive the insurer or to induce the insurer to
issue an insurance Policy:—
a) the suggestion, as a fact of that which is not true and which the Insured Person does
not believe to be true;
b) the active concealment of a fact by the Insured Person having knowledge or belief of
the fact;
c) any other act fitted to deceive; and
d) any such act or omission as the law specially declares to be fraudulent

Clause_Text:
CLAIM ADMINISTRATION
The fulfillment of the terms and conditions of this Policy (including payment of premium by the due
dates mentioned in the Policy Schedule) insofar as they relate to anything to be done or complied
with by each of You shall be conditions precedent to admission of Our liability.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions that must be met for the insurance company to fulfill its obligations under the policy.
Key_Terms: ['terms and conditions', 'Policy', 'payment of premium', 'due dates', 'Our liability']

Clause_Text:
You are requested to
go through our list of de-listed/excluded providers which is available on our website
Further, upon the discovery or happening of any Illness or Injury that may give rise to a Claim under
this Policy, then as a condition precedent to the admission of Our liability, You shall undertake the
following
1 CLAIMS PROCEDURE
(A) For Cashless Settlement
Cashless treatment is only available at a Network Provider (List of Network Providers
is available at our website).
Annotation_Notes: Requires the policyholder to seek treatment from a network provider for cashless settlement.

Clause_Text:
In order to avail of cashless treatment, the following
procedure must be followed by You:
Pre-authorization
Prior to taking treatment and/or incurring Medical Expenses at a Network Provider, You
must contact Us or Our in house claim processing team accompanied with full
particulars namely, Policy Number, Your name, Your relationship with Proposer, nature
of Illness or Injury, name and address of the Medical Practitioner/ Hospital and any
other information that may be relevant to the Illness/ Injury/ Hospitalisation.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the procedure for availing cashless treatment under the health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['Pre-authorization', 'Treatment', 'Medical Expenses', 'Network Provider', 'Policy Number', 'Your name', 'Relationship with Proposer', 'Nature of Illness or Injury', 'Medical Practitioner/ Hospital', 'Any other information']

request pre-authorisation at least 48 hours before a planned Hospitalisation and in case
of an emergency situation, within 24 hours of Hospitalisation.

To avail of Cashless
Hospitalisation facility, you are required to produce the health card, as provided to You
with this Policy, subject to the terms and conditions for the usage of the said health
card Or You can seek pre authorization by providing Your Policy number and ID proof
to the hospital who can co-ordinate with Our claim team to provide cashless facility.

(A) & (B), You must take reasonable steps or

If so requested by Us, You will have to undergo a medical examination from Our

The cost of such examination will be

Clause_Text:
Claim falling in two Policy Periods
If the claim event falls within two Policy periods, the claims shall be paid taking into
consideration the available Sum Insured in the two Policy Periods, including the Deductibles
for each Policy Period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the handling of claims that span across two policy periods.

insurance Policy, if not received earlier.

Clause_Text:
CLAIM SERVICE GUARANTEE
We provide You Claim Service Guarantee as follows
a) For Reimbursement Claims
We shall make the payment of admissible claim (as per terms & conditions of Policy) OR
communicate non admissibility of claim within 14 days after You submit complete set of
documents & information in respect of the claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for claim service guarantee, including the timeline for reimbursement claims and the communication of non-admissibility.
Key_Terms: ['Claim Service Guarantee', 'Reimbursement Claims', '14 days', 'Complete set of documents & information', 'Admissible claim', 'Terms & conditions of Policy']

Clause_Text:
In case We fail to make the payment of
admissible claim or to communicate non admissibility of claim within this time period, We
shall pay 2% interest over and above the rate defined as per IRDA (Protection of
Policyholder’s Interest) Regulations 2017 .
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the interest rate that will be charged if the insurance company fails to pay a claim or communicate non-admissibility within a specified time period, in accordance with the IRDA (Protection of Policyholder’s Interest) Regulations 2017.
Key_Terms: ['payment', 'admissible claim', 'time period', '2% interest', 'IRDA', 'Protection of Policyholder’s Interest Regulations 2017']

network hospitals along with complete set of documents & information, We will respond
within 4 hours of the actual receipt of such pre authorization request with:
i.

Approval, or

Clause_Text:
In case of delay in response by Us beyond the time period as stated above for cashless claims,
We shall be liable to pay ₹1,000 to You.

Clause_Text:
Our maximum liability in respect of a single
hospitalisation shall, at no time exceed ₹1,000.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the maximum amount that the insurance company will pay for a single hospitalization.

Clause_Text:
We will not be liable to make any payments under this Claim Service Guarantee in case of any
force majeure, natural event or manmade disturbance which impedes Our ability to make a
decision or to communicate such decision to You.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition under which the insurance company is not liable to make payments.

Clause_Text:
This service guarantee shall not be applicable for any cases delayed on account of reasonable
apprehension of fraud or fraudulent claims or cases referred to/by any adjudicative forum for
necessary disposal.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that the service guarantee does not apply to cases delayed due to reasonable suspicion of fraud or fraudulent claims, or cases referred to an adjudicative forum.

You may lodge claim separately for the hospitalisation claim, Pre-Post hospitalisation, optional
covers, OPD etc.

Clause_Text:
In such scenarios, if delay happens beyond the time period as specified
above, the interest amount calculated will be on the net sanctioned amount of respective
transaction and not the total amount paid for the entire claim.

Clause_Text:
In case of admission to a room at rates exceeding the limits as mentioned under (i), the reimbursement of
all other expenses incurred at the Hospital, with the exception of cost of Pharmacy/medicines, consumables,
implants, medical devices & diagnostics, shall be payable in the same proportion as the admissible rate per day
bears to the actual rate per day of room rent charges
b.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reimbursement of expenses when room rates exceed the mentioned limits, excluding certain items. It also specifies the proportion of reimbursement based on the admissible rate per day and the actual rate per day of room rent charges.

Clause_Text:
Proportionate deductions shall not apply in respect of the Hospitals which do not follow differential billings or for
those expenses in respect of which differential billing is not adopted based on the room category.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies conditions under which proportionate deductions do not apply in hospitals that do not follow differential billing or for expenses where differential billing is not adopted based on room category.

Clause_Text:
B. DEFINITIONS
Words or terms mentioned below have the meaning ascribed to them wherever they appear in this Policy, and
references to the singular or to the masculine, include references to the plural or to the feminine wherever the context
permits:
1.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines terms used throughout the policy.

Clause_Text:
Accident, Accidental –An accident is a sudden, unforeseen and involuntary event caused by external, visible and
violent means.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines what is considered an accident for the purpose of insurance claims.

Clause_Text:
Act of Terrorism:- Whoever
a.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the exclusion of coverage for acts of terrorism.

Clause_Text:
With intent to threaten the unity, integrity, security or sovereignty of India or to strike terror in the people or
any section of the people does any act or thing by using bombs, dynamite or other explosive substances
or inflammable substances or firearms or other lethal weapons or poisons or noxious gases or other
chemicals or by any other substances (whether biological or otherwise) of a hazardous nature or by any
other means whatsoever, in such a manner as to cause or likely to cause, death of or injuries to any person
or persons or loss of or damage to or destruction of property or disruption of any supplies or services
essential to the life of the community or causes damage or destruction of any property or equipment used
or intended to be used for the defense of India or in connection with any other purposes of the Government
of India, any state government or any of their agencies or detains any person and threatens to kill or injure
such person in order to compel the Government or any other person to do or abstain from doing any act
b.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the exclusion of coverage for any acts of terrorism that threaten the unity, integrity, security or sovereignty of India, cause harm to people or property, or disrupt essential services.
Key_Terms: ['terrorism', 'bombs', 'dynamite', 'explosive substances', 'inflammable substances', 'firearms', 'lethal weapons', 'poisons', 'noxious gases', 'chemicals', 'hazardous nature', 'death', 'injuries', 'loss', 'damage', 'destruction', 'property', 'supplies', 'services', 'defense', 'Government', 'state government', 'agencies', 'detains', 'persons', 'compel']

Clause_Text:
Is or continues to be a member of an association declared unlawful under the Unlawful Activities
(Prevention) Act 1967, (37 of 1967), or voluntarily does an act aiding or promoting in any manner the objects
of such association and in either case is in possession of any unlicensed firearms, ammunition, explosives
or other instrument or substances capable of causing mass destruction and commits any act resulting in
loss of human life or grievous injury to any person or causes significant damage to any property, commits
a terrorist act.
Annotation_Notes: This clause excludes coverage for any harm caused by terrorist activities or involvement in terrorist organizations.
Key_Terms: ['terrorist act', 'unlawful association', 'Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act', 'ammunition', 'explosives', 'mass destruction', 'loss of human life', 'grievous injury', 'property damage']

Clause_Text:
Any one illness: Any one illness means continuous Period of illness and it includes relapse within 45 days from the
date of last consultation with the Hospital/Nursing Home where treatment may have been taken.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the term 'Any one illness' in the context of health insurance, specifying that it refers to a continuous period of illness and includes relapse within 45 days from the date of last consultation.
Key_Terms: ['Any one illness', 'Continuous Period of illness', 'Relapse', '45 days', 'Last consultation', 'Hospital/Nursing Home']

Clause_Text:
AYUSH Hospital:
An AYUSH Hospital is a healthcare facility wherein medical/surgical/para-surgical treatment procedures and
interventions are carried out by AYUSH Medical Practitioner(s) comprising of any of the following:
a.
Annotation_Notes: The clause describes the type of healthcare facility covered under the policy

Clause_Text:
Central or State Government AYUSH Hospital; or
b.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the hospitals covered under the insurance policy, specifically mentioning Central or State Government AYUSH Hospitals.

Clause_Text:
Teaching hospital attached to AYUSH College recognized by the Central Government/Central Council of Indian
Medicine/Central Council for Homeopathy; or
c. AYUSH Hospital, standalone or co-located with in-patient healthcare facility of any recognized system of
medicine, registered with the local authorities, wherever applicable, and is under the supervision of a qualified
registered AYUSH Medical Practitioner and must comply with all the following criterion:
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirements for AYUSH hospitals to be recognized by the Central Government or Central Council of Indian Medicine/Central Council for Homeopathy, or to be registered with local authorities and supervised by a qualified AYUSH Medical Practitioner.
Key_Terms: ['AYUSH Hospital', 'Central Government', 'Central Council of Indian Medicine', 'Central Council for Homeopathy', 'Local authorities', 'Qualified registered AYUSH Medical Practitioner']

Clause_Text:
Having at least 5 in-patient beds;
ii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a minimum requirement for the number of in-patient beds in a healthcare facility covered by the insurance.

Clause_Text:
Having qualified AYUSH Medical Practitioner in charge round the clock;
iii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirement of a qualified Ayurveda medical practitioner being available round the clock.
Refers to the availability of AYUSH therapy sections and equipped operation theaters for surgical procedures.

Clause_Text:
Maintaining daily records of the patients and making them accessible to the insurance company’s authorized
representative.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirement for the policyholder to maintain and provide daily records of patients for the insurance company.

Clause_Text:
AYUSH Day Care Centre:
AYUSH Day Care Centre means and includes Community Health Centre (CHC), Primary Health Centre (PHC),
Dispensary, Clinic, Polyclinic or any such health centre which is registered with the local authorities, wherever
applicable and having facilities for carrying out treatment procedures and medical or surgical/para-surgical
interventions or both under the supervision of registered AYUSH Medical Practitioner (s) on day care basis without in-
patient services and must comply with all the following criterion:
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the types of health centers that are covered under the policy for day care treatments under AYUSH system.

Clause_Text:
Having qualified registered AYUSH Medical Practitioner(s) in charge;
ii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the requirement for a qualified AYUSH Medical Practitioner for treatment.
No specific vulnerabilities noted in this clause

Clause_Text:
Maintaining daily records of the patients and making them accessible to the insurance company’s authorized
representative.
Annotation_Notes: Requires clear definition of what constitutes 'daily records' and 'authorized representative'.

Clause_Text:
Bajaj Allianz Network Hospitals / Network Hospitals: Bajaj Allianz Network Hospitals / Network Hospitals means the
Hospitals which have been empanelled by Us as per the latest version of the schedule of Hospitals maintained by Us,
which is available to You on request.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the hospitals covered under the policy, subject to their empanelment by the insurer.

empanelled by us as per the latest version of the schedule of diagnostic centers maintained by Us, which is available
to You on request.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to diagnostic centers empanelled by the insurance provider
Key_Terms: ['Bajaj Allianz Diagnostic Centre', 'empanelled', 'latest version of the schedule of diagnostic centers']

Clause_Text:
Cashless facility: "Cashless facility” means a facility extended by the insurer to the insured where the payments, of
the costs of treatment undergone by the insured in accordance with the policy terms and conditions, are directly made
to the network provider by the insurer to the extent pre-authorization approved.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the cashless facility provided by the insurer to the insured, detailing the conditions under which the payments for treatments will be made directly to the network provider.

Clause_Text:
Certificate of Insurance means the document issued by the Company to the Insured Beneficiaryas per these terms
and conditions detailing the Cover Period, Insured Beneficiary name, address, age, coverage, sums insured,
condition(s), exclusions and or endorsement(s).
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the document issued by the company that outlines the coverage details for the insured beneficiary.

Clause_Text:
Provided however if there is any contradiction between what is stated
in the wordings attached to Certificate of Insurance and these Policy Wordings, then these Policy Wordings shall prevail.
Annotation_Notes: This clause clarifies the precedence of the policy wordings over the certificate of insurance in case of any contradiction.

Clause_Text:
Co-Payment: A co-payment is a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the
policyholder/insured will bear a specified percentage of the admissible claim amount.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the concept of co-payment in the context of health insurance policies.

Clause_Text:
A co-payment does not reduce
the Sum Insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause clarifies that the co-payment does not affect the total amount of coverage provided under the policy.

Clause_Text:
Condition Precedent: Condition Precedent shall mean a policy term or condition upon which the Insurer's liability under
the policy is conditional upon.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the concept of a 'Condition Precedent' in the context of insurance policies

Clause_Text:
Congenital Anomaly: Congenital Anomaly refers to a condition(s) which is present since birth, and which is abnormal
with reference to form, structure or position.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to congenital anomalies, which are conditions present since birth.

Clause_Text:
Internal Congenital Anomaly: Congenital anomaly which is not in the visible and accessible parts of the body
b.
Annotation_Notes: The clause refers to a congenital anomaly that is not visible or accessible, suggesting a pre-existing condition that may be covered under certain conditions.

Clause_Text:
External Congenital Anomaly: Congenital anomaly which is in the visible and accessible parts of the body
13.
Annotation_Notes: The clause refers to a congenital anomaly, which is a pre-existing condition. The specific anomaly is not specified, but it is mentioned to be visible and accessible.

Clause_Text:
Cumulative Bonus: Cumulative Bonus shall mean any increase in the Sum Insured granted by the insurer without an
associated increase in premium.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or complexity noted in this clause.

Clause_Text:
Day care centre: A day care centre means any institution established for day care treatment of illness and / or injuries
or a medical set -u p within a hospital and which has been registered with the local authorities, wherever applicable,
and is under the supervision of a registered and qualified medical practitioner AND must comply with all minimum
criteria as under:- has qualified nursing staff under its employment has qualified medical practitioner (s) in charge
has a fully equipped operation theatre of its own where surgical procedures are carried out- maintains daily records of
patients and will make these accessible to the Insurance company’s authorized personnel.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the conditions for a day care centre that is covered under the health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['day care centre', 'institution', 'hospital', 'registered medical practitioner', 'nursing staff', 'operation theatre', 'surgical procedures', 'daily records', "Insurance company's authorized personnel"]

Clause_Text:
Day Care Treatment: Day care treatment refers to medical treatment, and/or surgical procedure which is:
i. undertaken under General or Local Anesthesia in a hospital/day care centre in less than 24 hrs because of
technological advancement,
and
ii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the definition of day care treatment, which is a specific type of medical treatment or surgical procedure that is undertaken under general or local anesthesia in a hospital/day care center in less than 24 hours due to technological advancement.
Key_Terms: ['Day Care Treatment', 'General or Local Anesthesia', 'Hospital/Day Care Center', 'Technological Advancement']

Clause_Text: Which would have otherwise required a hospitalization of more than 24 hours.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the duration of hospitalization required for coverage to apply.

Clause_Text: Treatment normally taken on an out-patient basis is not included in the scope of this definition.
Annotation_Notes: This clause excludes treatment taken on an out-patient basis from the scope of the policy.

Clause_Text: Daily Allowance: Means the amount and period specified in the Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: The clause defines the term 'Daily Allowance' and specifies the method for determining it.

Clause_Text:
Deductible: Deductible is a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the insurer will
not be liable for a specified rupee amount in case of indemnity policies and for a specified number of days/hours in case
of Hospital Cash Daily Allowance policies which will apply before any benefits are payable by the insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the concept of a deductible in the context of a health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['Deductible', 'Cost-sharing requirement', 'Indemnity policies', 'Hospital Cash Daily Allowance policies', 'Liability', 'Rupee amount', 'Waiting Period']

Clause_Text:
A deductible
does not reduce the Sum Insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the relationship between the deductible and the Sum Insured.

Clause_Text:
Dental Treatment: Dental treatment is treatment carried out by a dental practitioner including examinations, fillings
(where appropriate), crowns, extractions and surgery excluding any form of cosmetic surgery/implants.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerabilities or ambiguities identified

Clause_Text:
Dependent child: A child is considered a dependent for insurance purposes until his 35th birthday (even if not enrolled
in an educational institution) provided he is financially dependent, on the proposal.
Annotation_Notes: The clause defines the age limit for a child to be considered a dependent for insurance purposes.

Clause_Text:
Disclosure to information norm:
The policy shall be void and all premium paid thereon shall be forfeited to the Company in the event of
misrepresentation, mis-description or non-disclosure of any material fact by the policyholder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences of the policyholder's non-disclosure of material facts.

Clause_Text:
Explanation: “Material facts” for the purpose of this policy shall mean all relevant information sought by the company in
the proposal form and other connected documents to enable it to take informed decision in the context of underwriting
the risk)
21.
Annotation_Notes: Definition of 'Material facts' in the context of this policy

Clause_Text:
Emergency Care: Emergency care means management for a severe illness or injury which results in symptoms which
occur suddenly and unexpectedly and requires immediate care by a medical practitioner to prevent death or serious
long term impairment of the Insured beneficiary’s health.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the conditions for emergency care coverage in the health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['Emergency care', 'severe illness', 'injury', 'symptoms', 'unexpectedly', 'immediate care', 'medical practitioner', 'death', 'serious long term impairment', 'Insured beneficiary’s health']

Clause_Text:
Family Definition for the purpose of Individual Sum Insured policy includes the insured; his/her lawfully wedded
spouse and dependent children & dependent parents
Family Definition for the purpose of Family Floater includes the insured; his/her lawfully wedded spouse and
dependent children.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the individuals covered under the policy for both Individual Sum Insured and Family Floater policies
Key_Terms: ['Family Definition', 'Individual Sum Insured', 'Family Floater', 'lawfully wedded spouse', 'dependent children', 'dependent parents']

Clause_Text: For Parents separate floater policy can be opted.

Clause_Text:
Grace Period: Grace period means the specified period of time immediately following the premium due date during
which a payment can be made to renew or continue a policy in force without loss of continuity benefits such as waiting
periods and coverage of pre-existing diseases.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the grace period for health insurance policies, during which a payment can be made to renew or continue the policy without losing continuity benefits such as waiting periods and coverage for pre-existing diseases.
Key_Terms: ['Grace period', 'premium due date', 'payment', 'policy', 'continuity benefits', 'waiting periods', 'pre-existing diseases']

Clause_Text:
Coverage is not available for the period for which no premium is
received.

Clause_Text:
Group Policy or Master Policy This Policy Document, the Policy Schedule and the Proposal, declaration and
applicable Endorsements under the Policy containing the terms and conditions of the insurance coverage and under
which Certificates of Insurance shall be issued to the Insured Beneficiary with the details of the extent of cover available
to the Insured Beneficiary, the Exclusions under the cover and the terms, conditions, warranties and limitations.

Policy Holder/Proposer/Group Administered or “Insured” is the Organization or Legal Entity which has taken the
Policy on behalf of all Insured Beneficiaries.

This clause defines the criteria for a hospital to be considered valid for insurance purposes.

Clause_Text:
Hospitalisation- Means admission in a Hospital for a minimum period of 24 In patient Care consecutive hours except
for specified procedures/ treatments, where such admission could be for a period of less than 24consecutive hours.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies the minimum duration for hospitalization to be covered under the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Hospitalisation', '24 In patient Care consecutive hours', 'specified procedures/ treatments', 'less than 24 consecutive hours']

Clause_Text:
Illness: Illness means a sickness or a disease or pathological condition leading to the impairment of normal
physiological function which manifests itself during the Policy Period and requires medical treatment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines what is considered an illness under the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Illness', 'sickness', 'disease', 'pathological condition', 'impairment', 'normal physiological function', 'requires medical treatment', 'Policy Period']

Clause_Text:
a) Acute condition - Acute condition is a disease, illness or injury that is likely to respond quickly to treatment
which aims to return the person to his or her state of health immediately before suffering the
disease/illness/injury which leads to full recovery.
Annotation_Notes: Defines what constitutes an acute condition

Clause_Text:
b) Chronic condition - A chronic condition is defined as a disease, illness, or injury that has one or more of
the following characteristics:—it needs ongoing or long-term monitoring through consultations,
examinations, check-ups, and /or tests—it needs ongoing or long-term control or relief of symptoms— it
requires your rehabilitation or for you to be specially trained to cope with it—it continues indefinitely—it
comes back or is likely to come back.
Annotation_Notes: Defines a chronic condition as a disease, illness, or injury that requires ongoing or long-term monitoring, control, rehabilitation, training, and has indefinite continuation and a likelihood of recurrence.

Clause_Text:
Inpatient Care: Inpatient care means treatment for which the insured person has to stay in a hospital for more than 24
hours for a covered event.
Annotation_Notes: The clause clearly defines the conditions for inpatient care coverage.

Clause_Text:
Injury/ Bodily Injury: Injury means accidental physical bodily harm excluding illness or disease solely and directly
caused by external, violent and visible and evident means which is verified and certified by a Medical Practitioner.
Annotation_Notes: The clause defines the term 'Injury' in the context of this health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['Injury', 'Bodily Injury', 'accidental physical bodily harm', 'excluding illness or disease', 'external, violent and visible and evident means', 'Medical Practitioner']

Clause_Text:
Intensive Care Unit: Intensive care unit means an identified section, ward or wing of a hospital which is under the
constant supervision of a dedicated medical practitioner(s), and which is specially equipped for the continuous
monitoring and treatment of patients who are in a critical condition, or require life support facilities and where the level
of care and supervision is considerably more sophisticated and intensive than in the ordinary and other wards.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or legal terms noted
Key_Terms: ['Intensive care unit', 'constant supervision', 'dedicated medical practitioner(s)', 'critical condition', 'life support facilities', 'ordinary wards']

Clause_Text:
Limit of Indemnity: Limit of Indemnity represents Our maximum liability to make payment for each and every claim per
person and collectively for all persons mentioned in the Schedule during the policy period and in the aggregate for the
person(s) named in the schedule during the policy period, and means the amount stated in the Schedule against each
Cover.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the maximum amount that the insurer will pay for each claim and in total for all claims during the policy period.

Clause_Text:
Medical Advise- Any consultation or advice from a Medical Practitioner including the issue of any prescription or repeat
prescription.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the medical advice and prescriptions provided by a medical practitioner.

Clause_Text:
Medical expenses: Medical Expenses means those expenses that an Insured Person has necessarily and actually
incurred for medical treatment on account of Illness or Accident on the advice of a Medical Practitioner, as long as these
are no more than would have been payable if the Insured Person had not been insured and no more than other hospitals
or doctors in the same locality would have charged for the same medical treatment.
Annotation_Notes: The clause defines the scope of medical expenses covered under the insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
Medical Practitioner/ Doctor/ Physician: A Medical Practitioner is a person who holds a valid registration from the
Medical Council of any State or Medical Council of India or Council for Indian Medicine or for Homeopathy set up by
the Government of India or a State Government and is thereby entitled to practice medicine within its jurisdiction; and
is acting within the scope and jurisdiction of license.
Annotation_Notes: Defines the qualifications of a medical practitioner who is eligible for coverage under the policy
Key_Terms: ['Medical Practitioner', 'Doctor', 'Physician', 'Medical Council', 'State', 'Medical Council of India', 'Council for Indian Medicine', 'Homeopathy', 'Government', 'license', 'jurisdiction']

Clause_Text:
Medically Necessary: Medically necessary treatment is defined as any treatment, tests, medication, or stay in hospital
or part of a stay in hospital which
i) is required for the medical management of the illness or injury suffered by the insured;
ii) must not exceed the level of care necessary to provide safe, adequate and appropriate medical care in
scope, duration, or intensity;
iii) must have been prescribed by a medical practitioner,
iv) must conform to the professional standards widely accepted in international medical practice or by the
medical community in India.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the criteria for medically necessary treatment under the health insurance policy.
Key_Terms: ['Medically necessary', 'treatment', 'tests', 'medication', 'hospital', 'illness', 'injury', 'insured', 'level of care', 'professional standards', 'international medical practice', 'medical community in India']

Clause_Text:
Migration- means, the right accorded to health insurance policyholders (including all members under family cover and
members under family cover and members of group health insurance policy), to transfer the credit gained for pre-
existing conditions and time bound exclusions, with the same insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the transferability of credits for pre-existing conditions and time-bound exclusions for health insurance policyholders and their family members.
Key_Terms: ['Migration', 'pre-existing conditions', 'time bound exclusions', 'health insurance policyholders', 'family cover', 'group health insurance policy']

Named Insured/ Insured: Insured means the persons, or his Family members, named in the Schedule provided that

commencement of the Policy Period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the eligibility criteria for the insured and their family members in terms of age.

Clause_Text: Non- Network: Any hospital, day care centre or other provider that is not part of the network.

Clause_Text:
Notification of Claim: Notification of claim is the process of notifying a claim to the insurer or TPA by specifying the

Clause_Text:
OPD treatment: OPD treatment is one in which the Insured visits a clinic / hospital or associated facility like a

Clause_Text:
The Insured is not
admitted as a day care or in-patient.

Clause_Text:
Portability: Portability means the right accorded to an individual health insurance policyholder (including all members

Pre-Existing Disease:
means any condition, ailment or injury or disease
a.

Clause_Text:
That is/are diagnosed by a physician within 48 months prior to the effective date of the policy issued by the
insurer or its reinstatement
or
b.

Clause_Text:
For which medical advice or treatment was recommended by, or received from, a physician within 48 months

45.

 Such Medical Expenses are incurred for the same condition for which the Insured Person’s Hospitalisation
was required, and
 The In-patient Hospitalization claim for such Hospitalization is admissible by the Insurance Company.

Clause_Text:

C. GENERAL EXCLUSIONS
We will not be liable to make any payment under this Policy under any circumstances, for any claim directly or indirectly
attributable to, or based on, or arising out of, or connected with any of the following:
I.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines situations where the insurance company will not be liable for payment under the policy.

Clause_Text:
Waiting Period
1.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the duration of a waiting period in a health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
Pre-existing Diseases waiting period (Excl01)
a) Expenses related to the treatment of a pre-existing Disease (PED) and its direct complications shall be excluded
until the expiry of 36 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first Family Health Care
Policy with us.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the exclusion of expenses related to pre-existing diseases and their complications during the first 36 months of continuous coverage.

Clause_Text: b) In case of enhancement of Sum Insured the exclusion shall apply afresh to the extent of Sum Insured increase.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the exclusion of coverage when there is an increase in the Sum Insured.

Clause_Text:
c) If the Insured is continuously covered without any break as defined under the portability norms of the extant IRDAI
(Health Insurance) Regulations then waiting period for the same would be reduced to the extent of prior coverage.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reduction of waiting period for health insurance coverage under certain conditions.

Clause_Text:
d) Coverage under the Policy after the expiry of 36 months for any pre-existing disease is subject to the same being
declared at the time of application and accepted by Us.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies a waiting period for coverage of pre-existing diseases after 36 months, which requires declaration at the time of application and acceptance by the insurer.

Clause_Text:
Specified disease/procedure waiting period (Excl02)
a) Expenses related to the treatment of the listed Conditions, surgeries/treatments shall be excluded until the expiry
of 24 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first Family Health Care Policy with Us.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies a waiting period for coverage of certain treatments or procedures related to specified diseases or surgeries.

Clause_Text: b) In case of enhancement of Sum Insured the exclusion shall apply afresh to the extent of Sum Insured increase.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the exclusion of coverage when there is an increase in the Sum Insured amount.

Clause_Text:
c) If any of the specified disease/procedure falls under the waiting period specified for Pre-Existing diseases, then the
longer of the two waiting periods shall apply.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the application of the longer waiting period for pre-existing diseases.

Clause_Text:
d) The waiting period for listed conditions shall apply even if contracted after the Policy or declared and accepted
without a specific exclusion.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains that the waiting period for listed conditions applies even if the policy is contracted after its issuance or if a specific exclusion is not mentioned.

Clause_Text:
e) If the Insured is continuously covered without any break as defined under the applicable norms on portability
stipulated by IRDAI, then waiting period for the same would be reduced to the extent of prior coverage.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reduction of waiting period under certain conditions related to continuous coverage.

D. CONDITIONS

Clause_Text:
Conditions Precedent
Where this Policy requires You to do or not to do something, then the complete satisfaction of that requirement
by You or someone claiming on Your behalf is a precondition to any obligation We have under this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions that must be met for the insurance policy to be valid.

Clause_Text:
If You
or someone claiming on Your behalf fails to completely satisfy that requirement, then We may refuse to consider
Your claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which an insurance claim may be denied.

Clause_Text:
Condition Precedent to Admission of Liability
The terms and conditions of the policy must be fulfilled by the Insured beneficiary for the Company to make any payment
for claim(s) arising under the policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition that the insured beneficiary must fulfill for the company to make any payment for claims arising under the policy.

Clause_Text:
Moratorium Period:
After completion of eight continuous years under this policy no look back would be applied.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the duration (8 years) after which a moratorium period will no longer apply in the context of this health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
This period of eight
years is called as moratorium period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the duration of a waiting period, specifically a moratorium period.

Clause_Text:
The moratorium would be applicable for the sums insured of the first policy
and subsequently completion of eight continuous years would be applicable from date of enhancement of sums
insured only on the enhanced limits.

contestable except for proven fraud and permanent exclusions specified in the policy contract.

The policies would
however be subject to all limits, sub limits, co-payments, as per the policy.

Insured

Claims Procedure
All Claims will be settled by In house claims settlement team of the company and no TPA is engaged.

Clause_Text:
If You meet with any Accidental Bodily Injury or suffer an Illness that may result in a claim, then as a condition
precedent to Our liability, You must comply with the following:
A. Cashless Claims Procedure:
Cashless treatment is only available at Network Hospitals.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for cashless treatment in network hospitals for accidental bodily injury or illness claims.

Clause_Text:
In order to avail of cashless treatment, the following
procedure must be followed by You or your representative:
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the steps required for the policyholder to avail of cashless treatment.

Clause_Text:
Prior to taking treatment and/or incurring Medical Expenses at a Network Hospital, You must call Us and
request pre-authorization by way of the written form.
Annotation_Notes: Requires policyholder to seek approval before receiving treatment at a network hospital

Clause_Text:
In case of planned hospitalization, You/the Insured beneficiary/ insured representative shall intimate such
admission within 48 hours of such hospitalization.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies a time frame for reporting planned hospitalization to the insurance company.

Clause_Text:
In case of Emergency hospitalization, You/the Insured beneficiary/ insured representative shall intimate
such admission within 24 hours of such hospitalization
iv.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a time limit for reporting emergency hospitalization to the insurance company.

Clause_Text:
On receipt of your pre-authorization form duly filled and signed by you, our representative then within 2
hours will respond with Approval, Rejection or more information.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the process for obtaining pre-authorization for a medical service.

Clause_Text:
v. After considering Your request and after obtaining any further information or documentation We have
sought, We may, if satisfied, send You or the Network Hospital, an authorization letter.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the process for authorizing a request after considering the request and obtaining any necessary information or documentation.

Clause_Text:
The authorization
letter, the ID card issued to You along with this Policy and any other information or documentation that
We have specified must be produced to the Network Hospital identified in the pre-authorization letter at
the time of Your admission to the same.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the requirement for the policyholder to provide certain documents at the time of admission to the specified network hospital.

Clause_Text:
If the procedure above is followed, You will not be required to directly pay for the bill amount in the
Network Hospital that We are liable under In-Patient Hospitalization Treatment above and the original
bills and evidence of treatment in respect of the same shall be left with the Network Hospital.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the payment process for in-patient hospitalization treatment under the network hospital.

Clause_Text:
Pre-
authorization does not guarantee that all costs and expenses will be covered.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies an exception to the coverage provided by the insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
We reserve the right to
review each claim for Medical Expenses and accordingly coverage will be determined according to the
terms and conditions of this Policy..
B.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the insurer's right to review claims for medical expenses and determine coverage based on the terms and conditions of the policy.

Clause_Text:
Reimbursement Claims Procedure:
If Pre-authorization as per Cashless Claims Procedure above is denied by Us or if treatment is taken in a Hospital

beneficiary or by his agent or the hospital/doctor/any other party acting on behalf of the Insured beneficiary, with
intent to deceive the insurer or to induce the insurer to issue an insurance policy:
a. the suggestion, as a fact of that which is not true and which the Insured beneficiary does not believe to be
true;
b. the active concealment of a fact by the Insured beneficiary having knowledge or belief of the fact;
c. any other act fitted to deceive; and
d. any such actor omission as the law specially declares to be fraudulent

knowledge of the insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the circumstances under which the insurance company can deny a claim based on fraud. It specifies that the insured beneficiary must prove that any misstatements were made in good faith and were not intentionally suppressing material facts.

Company.

Key_Terms: ['All waiting periods', 'Policy', 'Enhanced Sum Insured limit', 'Effective date', 'Policy Period', 'Company']

Clause_Text:
Addition /Deletion of Insured Person(s)
No person other than those persons named as the Insured Person(s) or those categories of the Insured specified in
the Schedule shall be covered under this Policy unless and until his/her name or the category has been notified in
writing to the Company, any additional premium due has been paid and the Company’s agreement to extend cover
has been indicated by it issuing an endorsement confirming the addition of such person or category of persons as
an Insured
Cover under this Policy shall be withdrawn from any Insured Person(s) named or any category of persons Insured
immediately upon the Policyholder delivering written notice of the same to the Company.
Subcategory: Addition and Deletion of Insured Persons
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for adding or deleting insured persons from the policy and the conditions that must be met.

Clause_Text:
The policyholder is required at the inception of the policy to make a nomination for the purpose of payment of claims
under the policy in the event of death of the policyholder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirement for the policyholder to nominate someone for claim payments in case of the policyholder's death.

Clause_Text:
Any change of nomination shall be communicated to the
company in writing and such change shall be effective only when an endorsement on the policy is made.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the method and conditions for changing the nominee of the policy.

Clause_Text:
In the event
of death of the policyholder, the Company will pay the nominee {as named in the Policy Schedule/Policy
Certificate/Endorsement (if any)} and in case there is no subsisting nominee, to the legal heirs or legal representatives
of the policyholder whose discharge shall be treated as full and final discharge of its liability under the policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the conditions under which the insurance company will pay out benefits in the event of the policyholder's death.

Clause_Text: We cover insured events arising during the Policy Period, as well as treatment availed, within India only.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the geographical area covered by the insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
Our liability to
make any payment shall be to make payment within India and in Indian Rupees only.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which payments will be made, including the currency and location.

Clause_Text: The Policy constitutes the complete contract of insurance.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the nature of the policy as the complete contract of insurance.

Clause_Text:
No change or alteration shall be valid or effective unless
approved in writing by Us, which approval shall be evidenced by an endorsement on the Schedule.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the requirement for approval in writing for any changes or alterations to the policy.

Clause_Text:
The construction, interpretation and meaning of the provisions of this Policy shall be determined in accordance with
Indian law.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the legal framework for interpreting the policy terms.

Clause_Text:
The section headings of this Policy are included for descriptive purposes only and do not form part of this
Policy for the purpose of its construction or interpretation.
Annotation_Notes: This clause clarifies the role of section headings in the policy document.

Clause_Text:
Arbitration and Reconciliation
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for resolving disputes through arbitration

Clause_Text:
If any dispute or difference shall arise as to the quantum to be paid under the Policy (liability being otherwise
admitted), such difference shall independently of all other questions be referred to decision of a sole arbitrator in
writing by the parties or if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator within 30 days of any party invoking arbitration,
the same shall be referred to a panel of the arbitrators comprising of two arbitrators, one appointed by each of the
parties to the dispute/difference and the third arbitrator to be appointed by such two arbitrators and arbitration shall
be conducted under and in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for resolving disputes over the quantum (amount) to be paid under the policy, in case of admitted liability. It refers to the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.

Clause_Text:
The law of
the arbitration will be Indian law, and the seat of the arbitration and venue for all hearings shall be within India.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies the jurisdiction for arbitration and the venue for hearings, which may impact the resolution of disputes in case of a claim.

Clause_Text:
It is clearly agreed and understood that no difference or dispute shall be referable to arbitration as herein before
provided, if We have disputed or not accepted liability under or in respect of this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which arbitration is not applicable in case of disputes related to the insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
It is hereby expressly stipulated and declared that it shall be a condition precedent to any right of action or suit upon
this Policy that award by such arbitrator/arbitrators of the amount of the loss or damage shall be first obtained.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the requirement for arbitration before any legal action can be taken on the policy.
Key_Terms: ['arbitrator', 'arbitrators', 'right of action', 'suit', 'Policy', 'amount of the loss or damage', 'obtained']

Clause_Text:
If these arbitration provisions are held to be invalid, then all such disputes or differences shall be referred to the
exclusive jurisdiction of the Indian Courts.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for resolving disputes if the arbitration provisions are deemed invalid.

Grievance Redressal Procedure
Welcome to Bajaj Allianz and Thank You for choosing us as your insurer.

Clause_Text:
This Policy records the entire agreement between Us and sets out what We insure, how We insure it, and
what We expect of You and what You can expect of Us.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the scope of the policy, specifying what is covered, how it is covered, and the expectations from both parties.

Clause_Text:
COVERAGE
Scope of cover:
The Company hereby agrees to pay reasonable and customary expenses in respect of an admissible claim, any or all of
the following covers subject to the Sum Insured, limits, terms, conditions and definitions, exclusions contained or otherwise
expressed in this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the types of expenses that the company will cover under the policy, subject to certain conditions.
Key_Terms: ['Company', 'Scope of cover', 'Reasonable and customary expenses', 'Admissible claim', 'Sum Insured', 'Terms', 'Conditions', 'Definitions', 'Exclusions']

Clause_Text:
1) In-patient Hospitalisation Treatment
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes a benefit or coverage for in-patient hospitalisation treatment.

Clause_Text: Room, Boarding and Nursing Expenses as provided by the Hospital/Nursing Home as per actuals.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to reimbursement for room, boarding, and nursing expenses incurred at a hospital or nursing home.

Clause_Text:
ICU Boarding and Nursing Expenses as provided by the Hospital/Nursing Home as per actuals
iii.
Annotation_Notes: The clause pertains to ICU boarding and nursing expenses, which is a specific type of hospital service covered under the policy.

Clause_Text: Surgeon, Anesthetist, Medical Practitioner, Consultants, Specialists Fees.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the fees charged by surgeons, anesthetists, medical practitioners, consultants, and specialists.

Clause_Text:
Anesthesia, Blood, Oxygen, Operation Theatre Charges, surgical appliances, Medicines & Drugs, Dialysis,
Chemotherapy, Radiotherapy, cost of Artificial Limbs, cost of prosthetic devices implanted during surgical
procedure like Pacemaker, orthopedic implants, infra cardiac valve replacements, vascular stents, relevant
laboratory diagnostic tests, X-ray and such similar expenses that are medically necessary.
Annotation_Notes: This clause covers a wide range of medical procedures and treatments, which could potentially lead to ambiguity or misinterpretation.
Key_Terms: ['Anesthesia', 'Blood', 'Oxygen', 'Operation Theatre Charges', 'surgical appliances', 'Medicines & Drugs', 'Dialysis', 'Chemotherapy', 'Radiotherapy', 'Artificial Limbs', 'prosthetic devices', 'Pacemaker', 'orthopedic implants', 'infra cardiac valve replacements', 'vascular stents', 'laboratory diagnostic tests', 'X-ray']

Clause_Text:
2) Pre- Hospitalisation Expenses
The Medical Expenses incurred during the 60 days immediately before you were Hospitalised, provided that: Such
Medical Expenses were incurred for the same illness/injury for which subsequent Hospitalisation was required, and We
have accepted an inpatient Hospitalisation claim under Benefit In Patient Hospitalisation Treatment Cover.
Annotation_Notes: This clause describes the conditions under which pre-hospitalization expenses are covered.
Key_Terms: ['Pre-Hospitalisation Expenses', '60 days', 'same illness/injury', 'Hospitalisation claim', 'Benefit In Patient Hospitalisation Treatment Cover']

Clause_Text:
3) Post-Hospitalisation
The Medical Expenses incurred during the 90 days immediately after You were discharged post Hospitalisation provided
that: Such costs are incurred in respect of the same illness/injury for which the earlier Hospitalisation was required,
and We have accepted an inpatient Hospitalisation claim under Benefit In Patient Hospitalisation Treatment Cover.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage provided for medical expenses incurred during the 90 days immediately after hospitalization.
Key_Terms: ['Post-Hospitalisation', '90 days', 'Medical Expenses', 'Same illness/injury', 'Benefit In Patient Hospitalisation Treatment Cover']

Clause_Text:
4) Road Ambulance
We will pay the reasonable cost to a maximum of Rs 3000/- per valid Hospitalisation claim incurred on an ambulance
offered by a healthcare or ambulance service provider for transferring You to the nearest Hospital with adequate
emergency facilities for the provision of health services following an Emergency.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage for road ambulance services in case of an emergency during hospitalization.
Key_Terms: ['Road Ambulance', 'Reasonable cost', 'Maximum Rs 3000/-', 'Hospitalisation claim', 'Emergency', 'Healthcare or ambulance service provider', 'Nearest Hospital', 'Adequate emergency facilities', 'Transferring You']

Clause_Text:
We will also reimburse the expenses incurred on an ambulance offered by a healthcare or ambulance service provider
for transferring You from the Hospital where you were admitted initially to another hospital with higher medical facilities.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reimbursement of ambulance expenses for patient transfer between hospitals.
Key_Terms: ['ambulance', 'healthcare or ambulance service provider', 'You', 'Hospital', 'higher medical facilities']

Clause_Text:
5) Day Care Procedures
We will pay you the medical expenses as listed above under 1.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a type of procedure covered under the policy.

Clause_Text:
In-patient Hospitalisation Treatment for Day care
procedures / Surgeries taken as an inpatient in a hospital or day care centre but not in the outpatient department.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to in-patient hospitalisation for day care procedures or surgeries.
Key_Terms: ['In-patient Hospitalisation', 'Day care procedures', 'Surgeries', 'Hospital or day care centre', 'Outpatient department']

Clause_Text: Indicative list of Day Care Procedures is given in the annexure I of Policy wordings.
Annotation_Notes: This clause indicates the list of day care procedures covered under the policy, which can be found in the annexure I of the policy wordings.

Clause_Text:
6) Organ Donor Expenses:
We will pay expenses incurred towards in case of major organ transplant, for harvesting of the organ provided that,
 The organ donor is any person whose organ has been made available in accordance and in compliance with THE
TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS (AMENDMENT) BILL, 2011 and the organ donated is for the use of
the Insured Person, and
 We have accepted an inpatient Hospitalization claim for the insured member under in patient Hospitalization
expenses.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of organ donor expenses in the event of a major organ transplant for the insured person.
Key_Terms: ['Organ Donor Expenses', 'Major organ transplant', 'Harvesting of the organ', 'The Transplantation of Human Organs (Amendment) Bill, 2011', 'Insured Person', 'Inpatient Hospitalization claim']

Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for triggering the reinstated Sum Insured, which is after the Hospitalization Sum Insured (including Cumulative Bonus, if applicable) has been completely exhausted during the policy period.
Key_Terms: ['Reinstated Sum Insured', 'Hospitalization Sum Insured', 'Cumulative Bonus', 'Policy Period', 'Exhausted']

Clause_Text:
The reinstated Sum Insured can be used for claims made by the Insured Person in respect of the
benefits stated in In Patient Hospitalisation Treatment Cover.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerable group mentioned, but the clause pertains to benefits for the insured person.
Key_Terms: ['Reinstated Sum Insured', 'Claims', 'Insured Person', 'In Patient Hospitalisation Treatment Cover']

Clause_Text:
If the claimed amount is higher than the Balance Sum Insured inclusive of the Cumulative Bonus (If
applicable) under the policy, then this benefit will not be triggered for such claims
iv.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a limit on the claim amount based on the Balance Sum Insured and Cumulative Bonus (if applicable).

Clause_Text:
The reinstated Sum Insured would be triggered only for subsequent claims made by the Insured
Person and not arising out of any illness/disease (including its complications) for which a claim has
been lodged in the current policy year under Section1 (In-patient Hospitalisation Treatment).
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies that the reinstated Sum Insured will not be triggered for any claims arising out of an illness/disease for which a claim has already been lodged in the current policy year under Section1 (In-patient Hospitalisation Treatment).
Key_Terms: ['reinstated Sum Insured', 'claim', 'Insured Person', 'illness/disease', 'current policy year', 'Section1', 'In-patient Hospitalisation Treatment']

Clause_Text:
v. This benefit is applicable only once during each policy period & will not be carried forward to the
subsequent renewals if the benefit is not utilized.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the renewal conditions for a benefit, stating that it is only applicable once during each policy period and will not be carried forward to subsequent renewals if not utilized.

Clause_Text:
This benefit is applicable only once in life time of Insured Person covered under this policy for claims
regarding CANCER OF SPECIFIED SEVERITY and KIDNEY FAILURE REQUIRING REGULAR
DIALYSIS as defined under the policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which cancer and kidney failure are covered under the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Cancer of specified severity', 'Kidney failure requiring regular dialysis', 'Once in lifetime']

Clause_Text: Additional premium would not be charged for reinstatement of the Sum Insured.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions for reinstatement of the Sum Insured without additional premium charge.

Clause_Text:
Incase Family Floater policy, Restore Sum Insured will be available for all Insured Persons in the
Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the restoration of the sum insured in a Family Floater policy for all insured persons.
Key_Terms: ['Family Floater policy', 'Restore Sum Insured', 'All Insured Persons']

Clause_Text:
8) Hospital Cash Benefit
If You are Hospitalised on the advice of a Medical Practitioner/Doctor as defined under the policy, because of Illness or
Accidental Bodily Injury sustained or contracted during the Policy Period, then We will pay You:
The Daily Allowance of Rs.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the payment of a daily allowance in case of hospitalization due to illness or accident.

Clause_Text:
500/- per day, for each continuous and completed period of 24 hours of Hospitalization
necessitated solely by reason of the said Accidental Bodily Injury or Sickness, subject to a maximum of 30 days during
the Policy Period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the daily benefit amount and maximum duration for hospitalization due to accidental bodily injury or sickness.
Key_Terms: ['500/- per day', '24 hours', 'Hospitalization', 'Accidental Bodily Injury or Sickness', 'Maximum of 30 days', 'Policy Period']

Clause_Text:
9) Preventive Health Check Up
At the end of a block of every continuous 3 policy years during which You have held Our Family Health Care policy,
You are eligible for a free Preventive Health checkup.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the eligibility for a free Preventive Health Checkup after every 3 continuous policy years.

Clause_Text:
We will reimburse the amount equal to 1% of the sum insured
max up to Rs 2000/- during the block of 3 years.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the amount and duration of reimbursement for the insured individual.

Clause_Text:
For the avoidance of doubt, We shall not be liable for any other ancillary or peripheral costs or expenses (including but
not limited to those for transportation, accommodation or sustenance).
Annotation_Notes: This clause excludes coverage for ancillary or peripheral costs and expenses such as transportation, accommodation, and sustenance.

Clause_Text: Contact Email id- healthcheck@bajajallianz.co.in.
Annotation_Notes: This clause provides the email address for customer support.

Clause_Text:
10) Ayurvedic / Homeopathic Hospitalisation Expenses
If You are Hospitalised for not less than 24 hours, in an Ayurvedic / Homeopathic Hospital which is a government
hospital or in any institute recognized by government and/or accredited by Quality Council of India/ National
Accreditation Board on Health on the advice of a Medical Practitioner/Doctor because of Illness or Accidental Bodily
Injury sustained or contracted during the Policy Period then We will pay You:
In-patient Treatment- Medical Expenses for Ayurvedic and Homeopathic treatment:
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of hospitalization expenses for Ayurvedic and Homeopathic treatments in government hospitals or institutes recognized by the government and/or accredited by Quality Council of India/ National Accreditation Board on Health, on the advice of a Medical Practitioner/Doctor due to illness or accidental bodily injury during the policy period.

ii.

B. DEFINITIONS
1) Accident, Accidental –An accident is a sudden, unforeseen and involuntary event caused by external, visible and
violent means.

Clause_Text:
2) Act of Terrorism:- Whoever
a.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines an exclusion related to acts of terrorism.

Clause_Text:
With intent to threaten the unity, integrity, security or sovereignty of India or to strike terror in the people or any
section of the people does any act or thing by using bombs, dynamite or other explosive substances or inflammable
Family Health Care (Gold) / UIN - BAJHLIP22024V032122/2
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the exclusion of coverage for any act that threatens the unity, integrity, security, or sovereignty of India or strikes terror in the people.

Clause_Text:
substances or firearms or other lethal weapons or poisons or noxious gases or other chemicals or by any other
substances (whether biological or otherwise) of a hazardous nature or by any other means whatsoever, in such a

destruction of property or disruption of any supplies or services essential to the life of the community or causes
damage or destruction of any property or equipment used or intended to be used for the defense of India or in

b.

Clause_Text:
Is or continues to be a member of an association declared unlawful under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act

substances capable of causing mass destruction and commits any act resulting in loss of human life or grievous
injury to any person or causes significant damage to any property, commits a terrorist act.

17) Deductible is a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the insurer will not be liable
for a specified rupee amount in case of indemnity policies and for a specified number of days/hours in case of Hospital
Cash Daily Allowance policies which will apply before any benefits are payable by the insurer.

long term impairment of the insured person’s health.

28) Hospitalisation- Means admission in a Hospital for a minimum period of 24 In patient Care consecutive hours except

29) Illness- Illness means a sickness or a disease or pathological condition leading to the impairment of normal
physiological function which manifests itself during the Policy Period and requires medical treatment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the minimum duration for hospitalization and the definition of illness in the health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
a) Acute condition - Acute condition is a disease, illness or injury that is likely to respond quickly to treatment
which aims to return the person to his or her state of health immediately before suffering the
disease/illness/injury which leads to full recovery.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or exclusion mentioned

Clause_Text:
b) Chronic condition - A chronic condition is defined as a disease, illness, or injury that has one or more of
the following characteristics:—it needs ongoing or long-term monitoring through consultations,
examinations, check-ups, and /or tests—it needs ongoing or long-term control or relief of symptoms— it
requires your rehabilitation or for you to be specially trained to cope with it—it continues indefinitely—it
comes back or is likely to come back.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines a chronic condition, which is a disease, illness, or injury that requires ongoing or long-term monitoring, control, relief of symptoms, rehabilitation, special training, and continues indefinitely or is likely to come back.

Clause_Text:
30) Inpatient Care- Inpatient care means treatment for which the insured person has to stay in a hospital for more than 24
hours for a covered event.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerability or ambiguity found

Clause_Text:
31) Injury/ Bodily Injury- Injury means accidental physical bodily harm excluding illness or disease solely and directly
caused by external, violent and visible and evident means which is verified and certified by a Medical Practitioner.

Clause_Text:

constant supervision of a dedicated medical practitioner(s), and which is specially equipped for the continuous
monitoring and treatment of patients who are in a critical condition, or require life support facilities and where the level
of care and supervision is considerably more sophisticated and intensive than in the ordinary and other wards.

Cover.

hospitals or doctors in the same locality would have charged for the same medical treatment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the scope of medical expenses covered under the insurance policy.

is acting within the scope and jurisdiction of license.

Clause_Text:
37) Medically Necessary: Medically necessary treatment is defined as any treatment, tests, medication, or stay in hospital
or part of a stay in hospital which
i) is required for the medical management of the illness or injury suffered by the insured;
ii) must not exceed the level of care necessary to provide safe, adequate and appropriate medical care in
scope, duration, or intensity;
iii) must have been prescribed by a medical practitioner,
iv) must conform to the professional standards widely accepted in international medical practice or by the
medical community in India.
Annotation_Notes: The clause defines what constitutes medically necessary treatment under the policy.

45) Pre-hospitalization Medical Expenses: Medical Expenses incurred immediately before the Insured Person is

was required, and
 The In-patient Hospitalization claim for such Hospitalization is admissible by the Insurance Company.

Hospitalised, provided that:

was required, and
 The In-patient Hospitalization claim for such Hospitalization is admissible by the Insurance Company.
