Clause_Text:
C. GENERAL EXCLUSION
We shall not be liable to make any payment for any claim directly or indirectly caused by, based on, arising out of or
attributable to any of the following:
I.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines a list of circumstances under which the insurance company will not be liable for payment of claims.

Clause_Text:
Pre-existing Diseases waiting period (Excl01)
a) Expenses related to the treatment of a pre-existing Disease (PED) and its direct complications shall be excluded
until the expiry of 36 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first Family Health Care

Clause_Text:
Conditions Precedent
Where this Policy requires You to do or not to do something, then the complete satisfaction of that requirement
by You or someone claiming on Your behalf is a precondition to any obligation We have under this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines conditions that must be met before the insurance company has any obligations under the policy.

Clause_Text:
If You
or someone claiming on Your behalf fails to completely satisfy that requirement, then We may refuse to consider
Your claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions under which a claim may be denied.

Clause_Text:
Condition Precedent to Admission of Liability
The terms and conditions of the policy must be fulfilled by the Insured Person for the Company to make any
payment for claim(s) arising under the policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions that the insured person must fulfill for the company to make any payment for claims under the policy.

Clause_Text:
Moratorium Period:
After completion of eight continuous years under this policy no look back would be applied.

Clause_Text:
This period of eight
years is called as moratorium period.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the duration of the waiting period for certain coverage, which could potentially be a point of confusion or misinterpretation for policyholders.

Clause_Text:
The moratorium would be applicable for the sums insured of the first policy
and subsequently completion of eight continuous years would be applicable from date of enhancement of sums
insured only on the enhanced limits.

Claims Procedure

Clause_Text:
If You meet with any Accidental Bodily Injury or suffer an Illness that may result in a claim, then as a condition
precedent to Our liability, You must comply with the following:
A. Cashless Claims Procedure:
Cashless treatment is only available at Network Hospitals.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions for cashless treatment at network hospitals in case of an accident or illness.

Clause_Text:
In order to avail of cashless treatment, the following
procedure must be followed by You or your representative:
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the steps that the policyholder must follow to receive cashless treatment.

Clause_Text:
Prior to taking treatment and/or incurring Medical Expenses at a Network Hospital, You must call Us and
request pre-authorisation by way of the written form.
Annotation_Notes: Requires policyholder to obtain pre-authorization for treatment at a network hospital before incurring medical expenses.

Clause_Text:
In case of Planned hospitalization , You/the insured person/ insured representative shall intimate such
admission within 48 hours of such hospitalization.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirement for the insured person or their representative to inform the insurer within 48 hours of planned hospitalization.

Clause_Text:
In case of Emergency hospitalization , You/the insured person/ insured representative shall intimate such
admission within 24 hours of such hospitalization.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the requirement for the insured person to inform the insurer within 24 hours of emergency hospitalization.

Clause_Text:
On receipt of your pre-authorization form duly filled and signed by you, our representative then within 2
hours will respond with Approval, Rejection or an more information
v. After considering Your request and after obtaining any further information or documentation We have
sought, We may, if satisfied, send You or the Network Hospital, an authorisation letter.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the response time for pre-authorization requests.
Key_Terms: ['pre-authorization form', '2 hours', 'Approval', 'Rejection', 'more information', 'further information or documentation', 'authorisation letter']

Clause_Text:
The authorisation
letter, the ID card issued to You along with this Policy and any other information or documentation that
We have specified must be produced to the Network Hospital identified in the pre-authorization letter at
the time of Your admission to the same.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the documents required for hospital admission under the policy.

Clause_Text:
If the procedure above is followed, You will not be required to directly pay for the bill amount in the
Network Hospital that We are liable under In-Patient Hospitalisation Treatment above and the original
bills and evidence of treatment in respect of the same shall be left with the Network Hospital.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the payment process for hospital bills when the insured individual is treated in a network hospital and the insurance company is liable for the in-patient hospitalization treatment.
Key_Terms: ['procedure', 'bill amount', 'Network Hospital', 'In-Patient Hospitalisation Treatment', 'original bills', 'evidence of treatment']

Clause_Text:
Pre-
authorisation does not guarantee that all costs and expenses will be covered.

Clause_Text:
We reserve the right to
review each claim for Medical Expenses and accordingly coverage will be determined according to the
terms and conditions of this Policy..

Clause_Text:
Reimbursement Claims Procedure:
If Pre-authorisation as per Cashless Claims Procedure above is denied by Us or if treatment is taken in a Hospital
other than a Network Hospital or if You do not wish to avail cashless facility, then:
i.

Clause_Text:
Paying a Claim
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the process of paying claims under the health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
You agree that We need only make payment when You or someone claiming on Your behalf has provided
Us with necessary documentation and information.

Clause_Text: We will make payment to You or Your Nominee.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the recipient of the insurance payment.

Clause_Text:
If there is no Nominee and You are incapacitated or
deceased, We will pay Your heir, executor or validly appointed legal representative and any payment We
make in this way will be a complete and final discharge of Our liability to make payment.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains what happens if the policyholder is deceased or incapacitated and there is no nominee.

Clause_Text:
Claim Settlement (provision for Penal Interest)
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the provision of penalty interest in case of claim settlement.

Clause_Text:
The Company shall settle or reject a claim, as the case may be, within 30 days from the date of receipt of last
necessary document.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies the time frame within which the company must settle or reject a claim.

Clause_Text:
In the case of delay in the payment of a claim, the Company shall be liable to pay interest to the policyholder from
the date of receipt of last necessary document to the date of payment of claim at a rate 2% above the bank rate.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions for the payment of interest on delayed claims.

Clause_Text:
However, where the circumstances of a claim warrant an investigation in the opinion of the Company, it shall
initiate and complete such investigation at the earliest, in any case not later than 30 days from the date of receipt
of last necessary document.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the time frame for the insurance company to investigate a claim, if deemed necessary.

Clause_Text:
In such cases, the Company shall settle or reject the claim within 45 days from the
date of receipt of last necessary document.
Annotation_Notes: The clause specifies the time frame within which the company must settle or reject a claim after receiving the last necessary document.

Clause_Text:
In case of delay beyond stipulated 45 days, the Company shall be liable to pay interest to the policyholder at a
rate 2% above the bank rate from the date of receipt of last necessary document to the date of payment of claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the rate at which the company will pay interest to the policyholder in case of a delay in claim processing.

(Explanation: “Bank rate” shall mean the rate fixed by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) at the beginning of the financial
year in which claim has fallen due)
10.

If You suffer a relapse within 45 days of the date when You last obtained medical treatment or consulted a

Clause_Text:
The day care procedures listed are subject to the exclusions, terms and conditions of the policy and will not be

Our obligation to make payment in respect of surgeries for cataracts (after the expiry of the 2 year period

v. If claim event falls within two policy periods the claims shall be administered taking into consideration the

claim amount to be payable shall be reduced up to the extent of the premium to be received for renewal/due

Cumulative Bonus:
If You renew Your Family Health Care with Us without any break and there has been no claim in the preceding year, We

Clause_Text:
If any claim made by the Insured beneficiary, is in any respect fraudulent, or if any false statement, or declaration
is made or used in support thereof, or if any fraudulent means or devices are used by the Insured beneficiary or
anyone acting on his/her behalf to obtain any benefit under this policy, all benefits under this policy and the
premium paid shall be forfeited.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences of making a fraudulent claim or providing false information in support of a claim.

Clause_Text:
Any amount already paid against claims made under this policy but which are found fraudulent later shall be
repaid by all recipient(s)/policyholder(s), who has made that particular claim, who shall be jointly and severally
liable for such repayment to the insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the consequences of fraudulent claims made under the policy.

Clause_Text:
For the purpose of this clause, the expression "fraud" means any of the following acts committed by the Insured
beneficiary or by his agent or the hospital/doctor/any other party acting on behalf of the Insured beneficiary, with
intent to deceive the insurer or to induce the insurer to issue an insurance policy:
a. the suggestion, as a fact of that which is not true and which the Insured beneficiary does not believe to be
true;
b. the active concealment of a fact by the Insured beneficiary having knowledge or belief of the fact;
c. any other act fitted to deceive; and
d. any such actor omission as the law specially declares to be fraudulent
iv.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines what constitutes fraudulent activities in the context of health insurance.

Clause_Text:
The Company shall not repudiate the claim and / or forfeit the policy benefits on the ground of Fraud, if the Insured
beneficiary / beneficiary can prove that the misstatement was true to the best of his knowledge and there was no
deliberate intention to suppress the fact or that such misstatement of or suppression of material fact are within the
knowledge of the insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which the insurance company can deny a claim based on fraud.

Clause_Text:
Free Look Period
The Free Look Period shall be applicable on new individual health insurance policies and not on renewals or at
the time of porting/migrating the policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the Free Look Period applicability for new individual health insurance policies, but not for renewals or porting/migrating the policy.
Key_Terms: ['Free Look Period', 'new individual health insurance policies', 'renewals', 'porting/migrating the policy']

Clause_Text:
The Insured beneficiary shall be allowed free look period of fifteen days from date of receipt of the policy

Clause_Text:
If the insured has not made any claim during the Free Look Period, the insured shall be entitled to
i. a refund of the premium paid less any expenses incurred by the Company on medical examination of the
Insured beneficiary and the stamp duty charges or
ii.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the conditions under which the insured can receive a refund of premium paid, given that no claim has been made during the Free Look Period.

Clause_Text:
where the risk has already commenced and the option of return of the policy is exercised by the Insured
beneficiary, a deduction towards the proportionate risk premium for period of cover or
iii.

Clause_Text:
Multiple Policies
a.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of multiple policies.

Clause_Text:
In case of multiple policies taken by an Insured beneficiary during a period from one or more insurers to
indemnify treatment costs, the Insured beneficiary shall have the right to require a settlement of his/her claim in
terms of any of his/her policies.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the rights of the insured beneficiary when multiple policies are taken.

Clause_Text:
In all such cases the insurer chosen by the Insured beneficiary shall be obliged
to settle the claim as long as the claim is within the limits of and according to the terms of the chosen policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the obligation of the insurer to settle the claim within the limits and terms of the chosen policy.

Clause_Text:
Insured beneficiary having multiple policies shall also have the right to prefer claims under this policy for the
amounts disallowed under any other policy / policies even if the sum insured is not exhausted.
Annotation_Notes: Refers to a situation where the insured has multiple policies and can prefer claims under this policy even if the sum insured is not exhausted due to disallowances under other policies.

Clause_Text:
Then the
insurer shall independently settle the claim subject to the terms and conditions of this policy.
Annotation_Notes: No specific vulnerabilities or complexities found.

Clause_Text:
c. If the amount to be claimed exceeds the sum insured under a single policy, the Insured beneficiary shall have
the right to choose insurer from whom he/she wants to claim the balance amount.

Clause_Text:
d. Where an Insured beneficiary has policies from more than one insurer to cover the same risk on indemnity
basis, the Insured beneficiary shall only be indemnified the treatment costs in accordance with the terms and
conditions of the chosen policy.

periods for all the previous policy years would be extended in the new policy, provided the policy has been

We may cancel this insurance by giving You at least 15 days written notice, and if no claim has been made then

Clause_Text:
Portability Conditions
The Insured beneficiary will have the option to port the policy to other insurers by applying to such insurer to port the
entire policy along with all the members of the family, if any, at least 45 days before, but not earlier than 60 days from
the policy renewal date as per IRDAI guidelines related to portability.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the conditions for transferring the policy to another insurer.

If such person is presently covered and has
been continuously covered without any lapses under any health insurance policy with an Indian General/Health
insurer, the proposed Insured beneficiary will get the accrued continuity benefits in waiting periods as per IRDAI
guidelines on portability.

This Policy constitutes the complete contract of insurance.

Clause_Text:
Addition /Deletion of Insured Person(s)
No person other than those persons named as the Insured Person(s) or those categories of the Insured specified in
the Schedule shall be covered under this Policy unless and until his/her name or the category has been notified in
writing to the Company, any additional premium due has been paid and the Company’s agreement to extend cover
has been indicated by it issuing an endorsement confirming the addition of such person or category of persons as
an Insured
Cover under this Policy shall be withdrawn from any Insured Person(s) named or any category of persons Insured
immediately upon the Policyholder delivering written notice of the same to the Company.

Clause_Text:
The policyholder is required at the inception of the policy to make a nomination for the purpose of payment of claims
under the policy in the event of death of the policyholder.

Clause_Text:

Clause_Text:
Arbitration and Reconciliation
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the method for resolving disputes between the insured and the insurance company.

Clause_Text:
If any dispute or difference shall arise as to the quantum to be paid under the Policy (liability being otherwise
admitted), such difference shall independently of all other questions be referred to decision of a sole arbitrator in
writing by the parties or if they cannot agree upon a single arbitrator within 30 days of any party invoking arbitration,
the same shall be referred to a panel of the arbitrators comprising of two arbitrators, one appointed by each of the
parties to the dispute/difference and the third arbitrator to be appointed by such two arbitrators and arbitration shall
be conducted under and in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for resolving disputes regarding the amount to be paid under the policy, in case of liability admission. It refers to the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.

Clause_Text:
The law of
the arbitration will be Indian law, and the seat of the arbitration and venue for all hearings shall be within India.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the governing law and location for arbitration in case of disputes.

Clause_Text:
It is clearly agreed and understood that no difference or dispute shall be referable to arbitration as herein before
provided, if We have disputed or not accepted liability under or in respect of this Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which arbitration is not applicable in case of disputes related to the policy.

Clause_Text:
It is hereby expressly stipulated and declared that it shall be a condition precedent to any right of action or suit upon
this Policy that award by such arbitrator/arbitrators of the amount of the loss or damage shall be first obtained.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the condition for any right of action or suit upon the policy, requiring arbitration as a prerequisite.

Clause_Text:
If these arbitration provisions are held to be invalid, then all such disputes or differences shall be referred to the
exclusive jurisdiction of the Indian Courts.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the process for resolving disputes if the arbitration provisions are deemed invalid.

Simple Oophorectomies
Note:
(i) Above mentioned list is a indicative list of procedures, any other surgeries/procedures requiring less than 24
hours hospitalization due to technological advances will also be covered under this policy provided such
procedures comply with the standard definition of Day Care Centre and Day Care treatment mentioned in the
definitions.

Clause_Text:

medical condition/disease under treatment.

Clause_Text:
Room Rent & Proportionate deduction: In case of admission to a room at rates exceeding
the aforesaid limits, the reimbursement/payment of Room Rent charges including all
Associated Medical Expenses incurred at Hospital shall be effected in the same proportion
as the admissible rate per day bears to the actual rate per day of Room Rent charges.
Subcategory: Room Rent and Associated Medical Expenses
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reimbursement of room rent and associated medical expenses when the admitted room rate exceeds the specified limit.
Key_Terms: ['Room Rent', 'Proportionate deduction', 'Admissible rate', 'Actual rate', 'Reimbursement', 'Associated Medical Expenses']

This
condition is not applicable in respect of Hospitals where differential billing for Associated

medical attention)

We will indemnify the Insured Person towards the cost of Preventive Health Check – Up, up to
the limit mentioned on the Schedule of Coverage in the Policy Schedule/Certifiate of Insurance.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the coverage for preventive health check-ups with a specified limit.
Key_Terms: ['Preventive Health Check-Up', 'Indemnify', 'Cost', 'Limit', 'Schedule of Coverage', 'Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance']

Clause_Text:
Other terms and Conditions applicable to this Coverage
 The Coverage will be applicable as per the eligibility as mentioned on the Schedule of
Coverage in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.
Annotation_Notes: This clause defines the conditions under which the coverage applies, based on the eligibility criteria mentioned in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.

Clause_Text:
 In case of Annual Eligibility, the percentage and limit will be calculated on expiring
Coverage Sum Insured and will be only applicable to Insured Person covered under
expiring Coverage, subject to no claim under Base Coverage.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the calculation of percentage and limit for annual eligibility, applicable only to the insured person covered under expiring coverage, and subject to no claim under base coverage.
Key_Terms: ['Annual Eligibility', 'Percentage', 'Limit', 'Coverage Sum Insured', 'Insured Person', 'Expiring Coverage', 'Base Coverage', 'Claim']

Clause_Text:
 In case of Eligibility at the end of each block of continuous years (as mentioned on the
Schedule of Coverage), the percentage and limit will be calculated on Average Sum
Insured during block of three years and will be only applicable to Insured Person covered
for all previous 3 years.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the method for calculating eligibility at the end of each block of continuous years in terms of percentage and limit based on Average Sum Insured during a block of three years.
Key_Terms: ['Eligibility', 'Block of continuous years', 'Average Sum Insured', 'Insured Person', 'Previous 3 years']

Clause_Text:
Cumulative Bonus
On each continuous Renewal of the Coverage with Us, We will apply 10% of Base Sum Insured
irrespective of any claims and shall be available under the Renewed Policy as specified in the
Schedule of Coverage in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance under expiring policy year as
Cumulative Bonus in the Coverage provided that;
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the accumulation of bonus on each renewal of the health insurance policy

Clause_Text:
Cumulative Bonus can be accumulated upto the limit mentioned in the Schedule of Coverage on the
Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the accumulation of Cumulative Bonus within the limit mentioned in the Schedule of Coverage.
Key_Terms: ['Cumulative Bonus', 'Schedule of Coverage', 'Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance']

Clause_Text:
Cumulative Bonus applied will be applicable only to Insured Person(s) covered under the expiring
policy year and who continue to remain insured on Renewal.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the conditions for the application of a cumulative bonus during renewal.

Clause_Text:
In policies with a 2/3 year Policy Period, the application of above guidelines of Cumulative Bonus shall
be post completion of each policy year.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the application of cumulative bonus in policies with a 2/3 year Policy Period, and the condition that the bonus will be applied only after the completion of each policy year.
Key_Terms: ['Policy Period', 'Cumulative Bonus', '2/3 year', 'Completion of each policy year']

Clause_Text:
Portability/migration benefit will be offered to the extent of sum of previous sum insured and accrued
Cumulative bonus, portability/migration benefit shall not apply to any other additional increased Sum

and once added, the accumulated amount will be carried forward to the subsequent Policy Year,
subject to there being no Break in Policy

Hospitalization for Alternative Treatments

Clause_Text:
Restore Benefit
Instant addition of 100% Base Sum Insured on complete or partial utilization of Your existing
Policy Sum Insured and Cumulative Bonus (if applicable) during the Policy Year.

Clause_Text:
The Total

all Insured Persons for all claims under the Coverage during the current Policy Year and subject
to the condition that single claim in a Policy Year cannot exceed the sum of Base Sum Insured
and the Cumulative Bonus (if applicable).
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the maximum claim limit per policy year for each insured person under the health insurance policy.

Clause_Text:
Alternative Treatment
We will pay Medical Expenses covered under Section A or B as opted, only on Medically
Necessary In-patient care treatment of Insured Person in Ayush Hospital upto the limit

following Alternative Treatments prescribed by Medical Practitioner:
 Ayurvedic
 Unani
 Siddha
 Homeopathy
 Yoga & Naturopathy
Note : Alternative Treatment is no longer an optional cover.

Clause_Text:
Waiting Periods
Claims under the Policy are covered subject to Waiting Period as specified below:
i) Pre-existing Diseases – Code – Excl01
a) Expenses related to the treatment of a pre-existing disease (PED) and its direct
complications shall be excluded until the expiry of 36 months of continuous coverage after
the date of inception of the first Policy with insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the exclusion of coverage for expenses related to pre-existing diseases and their direct complications for the first 36 months of continuous coverage.

Clause_Text:
b) In case of enhancement of Sum Insured the exclusion shall apply afresh to the extent of
sum of Sum Insured increase.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies that if the Sum Insured is increased, the exclusion will apply afresh to the extent of the increased Sum Insured.

Clause_Text:
HDFC ERGO General Insurance
c) If the Insured Person is continuously covered without any break as defined under the
portability norms of the extant IRDAI (Health Insurance) Regulations, then waiting period for
the same would be reduced to the extent of prior coverage.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reduction of waiting period for the same coverage when the insured person is continuously covered without any break as per IRDAI regulations.
Key_Terms: ['Insured Person', 'Continuously covered', 'Waiting period', 'Portability norms', 'IRDAI (Health Insurance) Regulations', 'Prior coverage']

Clause_Text:
d) Coverage under the Policy after the expiry of 36 months for any pre-existing disease is
subject to the same being declared at the time of application and accepted by Insurer.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of pre-existing diseases after 36 months, subject to their declaration at the time of application and acceptance by the insurer.

Clause_Text:
ii) Specified Disease/Procedure waiting period - Code - Excl02
a) Expenses related to the treatment of the listed Conditions, surgeries/treatments shall be
excluded until the expiry of 24 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of
the first Policy with us.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a waiting period for expenses related to treatment of listed conditions or surgeries/treatments, which are excluded for the first 24 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy.
Key_Terms: ['Specified Disease/Procedure waiting period', '24 months', 'continuous coverage', 'treatment', 'surgeries/treatments', 'expiry', 'inception', 'first Policy']

Clause_Text:
This exclusion shall not be applicable for claims arising due to an
Accident.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition under which the exclusion does not apply, i.e., when the claim arises due to an accident.

Clause_Text:
b) In case of enhancement of Sum Insured the exclusion shall apply afresh to the extent of
Sum Insured increase.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the circumstances under which the enhancement of Sum Insured may lead to a fresh application of exclusions.

Clause_Text:
c) If any of the specified disease/procedure falls under the waiting period specified for Pre-
existing diseases, then the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the waiting period for pre-existing diseases and specifies that the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply.

Clause_Text:
d) The waiting period for listed conditions shall apply even if contracted after the Policy or
declared and accepted without a specific exclusion.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the waiting period for certain conditions, even if the policy is contracted after its declaration.

Clause_Text:
e) If the Insured Person is continuously covered without any break as defined under the
applicable norms on portability stipulated by IRDAI, then waiting period for the same would
be reduced to the extent of prior coverage.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the reduction of waiting period for coverage when the insured person has continuous coverage as defined by IRDAI norms on portability.

Clause_Text:
Non - Disclosure or Misrepresentation
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the consequences of withholding information or providing false information during the application process.

Clause_Text:
If at the time of issuance of Policy or during continuation of the Policy, the information
provided to Us in the Proposal Form or otherwise, by You or the Insured Person or anyone
acting on behalf of You or an Insured Person, is found to be incorrect, incomplete,
suppressed or not disclosed, wilfully or otherwise, the Policy shall be:
a) cancelled ab initio from the inception date or the Renewal date (as the case may be),
or the Policy may be modified by Us at Our sole discretion, upon 30 day notice by
sending an endorsement to Your address shown in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of
Insurance, and
b) the claim under such Policy if any, shall be prejudiced.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences of providing incorrect, incomplete, suppressed, or undisclosed information during the policy issuance or continuation. It allows the insurer to cancel the policy from its inception or modify it at their discretion, and also prejudices any claim under such policy.

Clause_Text:
We may also exercise any of the below listed options for the purpose of continuing the health
insurance coverage in case of Non-Disclosure/Misrepresentation of Pre-existing Diseases
subject to your prior consent;
a) Permanently exclude the disease/condition and continue with the Policy
b) Incorporate additional waiting period of not exceeding 4 years for the said undisclosed
disease or condition from the date the non-disclosed condition was detected and
continue with the Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause outlines the consequences of non-disclosure or misrepresentation of pre-existing diseases in a health insurance policy, which may result in the exclusion of the disease/condition or the addition of a waiting period.

Clause_Text:
c) Levy underwriting loading from the first year of issuance of Policy or renewal,
whichever is later.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions under which a loading fee may be applied to the policy premium.

Clause_Text:
The above options will not prejudice the rights of the Company to invoke cancellation under
clause 1 i above.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies a condition under which the insurance company can cancel the policy, even if other options are not exercised.

Clause_Text:
Disclosure of Information
The Policy shall be void and all premium paid thereon shall be forfeited to the Company in
the event of misrepresentation, mis description or non-disclosure of any Material Fact by the
Policyholder.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the consequences of non-disclosure of material facts by the policyholder, leading to the voiding of the policy and forfeiture of premium.

Clause_Text:
10.Condition Precedent to Admission of Liability
The terms and conditions of the Policy must be fulfilled by the Insured Person for the
Company to make any payment for claim(s) arising under the Policy.
Annotation_Notes: This clause specifies the conditions that the insured person must fulfill for the company to make a payment for claims arising under the policy.

Clause_Text:
HDFC ERGO General Insurance
11.Complete Discharge
Any payment to the Policyholder, Insured Person or his/ her nominees or his/ her legal
representative or assignee or to the Hospital, as the case may be, for any benefit under the
Policy shall be a valid discharge towards payment of claim by the Company to the extent of
that amount for the particular claim.
Annotation_Notes: This clause explains the conditions under which the insurance company considers a discharge as valid and a complete payment towards the claim.

Clause_Text:
12.Multiple Policies
i.
Annotation_Notes: This clause pertains to the coverage of multiple policies.

Clause_Text:
In case of multiple policies taken by an Insured Person during a period from one or more
insurers to indemnify treatment costs, the Insured Person shall have the right to require a
settlement of his/her claim in terms of any of his/her policies.
